analyzed: mig la sogs pa sngar med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: It would be only one aggregate,

analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness alone would exist.

original: yang na gal te sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa yod na ni phung po gnyis yin te /
analyzed: yang na gal te sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa yod na ni phung po gnyis yin te /
translated: Or, if there is no mind, it would be two aggregates,

original: de dag 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those aggregates are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: ming mtha' dag la dgongs nas de @149b skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhe na yang zhes bya ba der 'di snyam du tshe gcig ril mtha' dag gi ming la dgongs nas ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming mtha' dag la dgongs nas de @149b skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhe na yang zhes bya ba der 'di snyam du tshe gcig ril mtha' dag gi ming la dgongs nas ming gang zhe na /
translated: If you think that the aggregates are distinguished in this way with reference to the entirety of name, then you should say, ‚ÄúWith reference to the entirety of name in one lifetime, what is name?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o zhes da skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o zhes da skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The four non-material aggregates.‚Äù

original: mi rung ste skye mched drug gi rkyen du gyur pa'i ming dang gzugs 'dir brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rung ste skye mched drug gi rkyen du gyur pa'i ming dang gzugs 'dir brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: That is unacceptable because it is asserted that name and form that are conditions for the six sense bases are described here.

original: tshe mtha' dag gi ming la dgongs nas de skad du rnam par phye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe mtha' dag gi ming la dgongs nas de skad du rnam par phye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not asserted that name and form is classified in this way with the intention of referring to name and form throughout life.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'di las skye mched drug gi rkyen du gyur pa'i ming dang gzugs brjod par bzhed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo sde 'di las skye mched drug gi rkyen du gyur pa'i ming dang gzugs brjod par bzhed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no /
translated: Thus it is asserted that name and form that is a condition for the six sense bases is described in this dependent origination sutra and not anything else.

original: tshe mtha' dag gi ming dang gzugs kyang skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin pas de rnam par phye ba 'di ma yin par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe mtha' dag gi ming dang gzugs kyang skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin pas de rnam par phye ba 'di ma yin par nges par bya'o //
translated: Also name and form throughout life is not a condition for the six sense bases, so it is certain that it is not classified here.

original: ci'i ming gzugs she na /
analyzed: ci'i ming gzugs she na /
translated: Why is it called name and form?

original: 'di rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is asserted that name and form is described as a condition for consciousness.

original: 'di ltar kha cig ni tshe mtha' dag gi ming dang gzugs ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin par 'dod de 'dir yang 'di la dgongs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhi pa'i ming dang gzugs bstan pa 'dir yang ming mtha' dag la dgongs
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig ni tshe mtha' dag gi ming dang gzugs ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin par 'dod de 'dir yang 'di la dgongs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni phung po bzhi pa'i ming dang gzugs bstan pa 'dir yang ming mtha' dag la dgongs
translated: Some assert that name and form throughout one‚Äôs entire life is a condition for consciousness, and here this is the intended meaning.

original: nas de skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: nas de skad du rnam par phye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is that this is the explanation of name and form in the four aggregates, and here the intended meaning is that this is the analysis of name and form in terms of all names.

original: skye mched drug gi tshig de la dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par yin no zhes gang smras pa de la dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi tshig de la dgongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par yin no zhes gang smras pa de la dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is not that the statement ‚ÄúThe six sense bases‚Äù is the intended meaning.üîΩThe intended meaning is that this is the analysis of name and form in terms of all names.

original: ming mtha' dag la dgongs nas de ltar rnam par phye ba yin no zhes de la dgongs pa yin na ni dgongs pa 'di ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming mtha' dag la dgongs nas de ltar rnam par phye ba yin no zhes de la dgongs pa yin na ni dgongs pa 'di ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is the intended meaning, then this intended meaning is contradicted.

original: sngar ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na skye mched gnyis yod pa de bas na reg pa yang yod pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa yang yod pa yin pas ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa nyid yin gyi de lta ma yin na ming phung po bzhi
analyzed: sngar ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na skye mched gnyis yod pa de bas na reg pa yang yod pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa yang yod pa yin pas ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa nyid yin gyi de lta ma yin na ming phung po bzhi
translated: Since the two bases of name and form exist at the stage of name and form, contact also exists and therefore feeling and so on also exist.

original: par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If that were not so, how could the four mental aggregates be established as name?

original: de la gtan tshigs ci yod ces smras pa'i gtan tshigs ni /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs ci yod ces smras pa'i gtan tshigs ni /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las mtha' dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las mtha' dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: The reason is stated because the entire range of the great elements is mentioned.

original: 'di ltar rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las tshe gcig ma lus pa mtha' dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs smos pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las tshe gcig ma lus pa mtha' dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs smos pa yin te /
translated: Thus the entire range of the great elements is mentioned in the Compendium of Reasons because name and form are stated as the condition of consciousness in the entire range of one life.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te khye'u 'am bu mo'i rnam par @150a * //
analyzed: gal te khye'u 'am bu mo'i rnam par @150a * //
translated: If a boy or girl

original: shes pa chad cing zhigs te med par gyur na de'i ming dang gzugs rgya che ba dang 'phel ba dang / yangs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa chad cing zhigs te med par gyur na de'i ming dang gzugs rgya che ba dang 'phel ba dang / yangs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If consciousness were to cease and be destroyed and not exist, would name and form increase, expand and flourish?

original: gzhan du de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyogs de ni lan btab zin te /
analyzed: gzhan du de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyogs de ni lan btab zin te /
translated: We have already responded to this point in the section on the presentation of name and form.

original: ji skad du rnam par shes pa'i yan lag rnam par dbye ba las de 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la dgongs nas bstan pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par shes pa'i yan lag rnam par dbye ba las de 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa la dgongs nas bstan pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par smras pa yin no //
translated: In the chapter on the analysis of consciousness, we extensively explain that the Buddha did not intend to teach that name and form are conditions of consciousness through the action of contact.üîΩMoreover, if prior to contact, name and form are conditions of the six sense bases, then prior to contact, name and form would be conditions of the six sense faculties.

original: gzhan yang gal te reg pa'i snga rol du sems las byung ba'am zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te reg pa'i snga rol du de'i gnas skabs na ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te reg pa'i snga rol du sems las byung ba'am zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te reg pa'i snga rol du de'i gnas skabs na ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na /
translated: If prior to contact, name and form are conditions of the six sense bases, then prior to contact, name and form would be conditions of the six sense faculties.

original: sems las byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin zhing mi ldan pa srog gi dbang po la sogs pa'i rdzas yod pa ma yin na de'i tshe 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming phung po bzhi pa gang
analyzed: sems las byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin zhing mi ldan pa srog gi dbang po la sogs pa'i rdzas yod pa ma yin na de'i tshe 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming phung po bzhi pa gang
translated: If mental factors such as feeling and so on do not exist, and the substantially existent nonmental factors such as the faculty of life force do not exist, then at that time you must explain what is the name-and-form that is conditioned by consciousness that is infused by the formations.

original: zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos te nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na reg pa med na yang tshor ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhig yin pa brjod par bya dgos te nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na reg pa med na yang tshor ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no contact in the state of kalala and so on, then feeling and so on also do not exist.

original: reg pa'i 'og tu yang ming ji ltar yin na rnam pa gang gis ming phung po bzhi pa yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: reg pa'i 'og tu yang ming ji ltar yin na rnam pa gang gis ming phung po bzhi pa yod par 'gyur /
translated: And if name does not exist after contact, by what aspect would the four aggregates that are name exist?

original: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las mtha' dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa der yang ming dang gzugs ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa yod par bya dgos shing /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs las mtha' dag smos pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa der yang ming dang gzugs ma gtogs par rnam par shes pa yod par bya dgos shing /
translated: You may say that the term all is mentioned in the synonyms of the great ground of being, but in that case you must accept that consciousness exists without name-and-form.

original: rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs par yang phung po lnga pa'i ming dang gzugs yod par bya dgos na tshor ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po de ni ming phung po bzhi pa yin no zhes brjod pa yang rigsüîΩpa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs par yang phung po lnga pa'i ming dang gzugs yod par bya dgos na tshor ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po de ni ming phung po bzhi pa yin no zhes brjod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, apart from consciousness, you would have to posit name-and-form of the five aggregates, but it is not logical to say that the aggregate of consciousness that is concomitant with feeling and so on is the four aggregates of name.

original: de'i rkyen med pa'i phyir dang / ming nyid ming gi rkyen ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rkyen med pa'i phyir dang / ming nyid ming gi rkyen ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its conditions do not exist, name is not the condition of name and consciousness is not the condition of consciousness.

original: de bas na gnyis po de 'dod par byos shig ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar reg pa'i snga rol du ming yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis po de 'dod par byos shig ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar reg pa'i snga rol du ming yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, you should accept that these two exist, because in that way name does not exist prior to contact,

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact does not exist in the state of kalala and so on.

original: reg pa'i 'og tu yang tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na phung po bzhi pa'i ming yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg pa'i 'og tu yang tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na phung po bzhi pa'i ming yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, after contact, the four aggregates of name do not exist in the state of feeling and so on,üîΩbecause the four aggregates of name do not exist in the state of feeling and so on.

original: ming dang gzugs la ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no consciousness apart from name-and-form.

original: @150b de bas na de gnyis ni 'dod par bya dgos pa ni 'di lta ste reg pa'i snga rol ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na reg pa dang reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: @150b de bas na de gnyis ni 'dod par bya dgos pa ni 'di lta ste reg pa'i snga rol ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na reg pa dang reg pa'i 'og tu tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that the store-consciousness is the name-and-form in the state prior to contact, and that it is the feeling, etc. in the state subsequent to contact.

original: de ltar byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of this?

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ming 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ming 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The name-and-form in the state of the kalala, etc. is established.

original: reg pa'i 'og tu yang tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na phung po bzhi pa'i ming 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i 'og tu yang tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na phung po bzhi pa'i ming 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the four aggregates in the state of feeling, etc. subsequent to contact are established.

original: de ltar byas na gang yang rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs nam ma shi'i bar du ming dang gzugs ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin no zhes bya ba de rud bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na gang yang rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs nam ma shi'i bar du ming dang gzugs ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin no zhes bya ba de rud bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the statement in the sutra, ‚ÄúName-and-form has consciousness as its condition up until the great mass of suffering is established,‚Äù is not contradicted.

original: phung po bzhi pa'i ming lam gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhi pa'i ming lam gtogs par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the four aggregates exist, except for the name aggregate, in the foundation consciousness.

original: de las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni ming yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni lus kyi bdag nyid nur nur po de las skye ba'am der skyes pas na de las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni ming yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni lus kyi bdag nyid nur nur po de las skye ba'am der skyes pas na de las skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Name is the feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness that arise from that foundation consciousness.

original: nur po nur po'i gnas skabs na reg pa yod pa'i khungs ni mdo sde 'di yin te /
analyzed: nur po nur po'i gnas skabs na reg pa yod pa'i khungs ni mdo sde 'di yin te /
translated: The source for the existence of contact in the embryonic stage of kalala is this sutra.

original: reg pa med par tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa med par tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without contact, feeling and so on do not exist.

original: de ltar na ni lus dang yid gnyis kyang skye mched nyid yin par de'i tshe 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni lus dang yid gnyis kyang skye mched nyid yin par de'i tshe 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the body and mind would also be established as the sense bases at that time.

original: yang gsungs pa de de'i dus kyi tshe dbang po gsum 'thob par 'gyur te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde de nyid las yang gsungs pa nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs de'i dus kyi tshe des dbang po gsum 'thob pa
analyzed: yang gsungs pa de de'i dus kyi tshe dbang po gsum 'thob par 'gyur te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde de nyid las yang gsungs pa nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs de'i dus kyi tshe des dbang po gsum 'thob pa

analyzed: ni lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po ste /
translated: the body faculty, the mental faculty and the life faculty.üîΩThe body faculty and the mental faculty are the faculties that are included in the six sense bases, from the perspective of their basis.

original: de ni skye mched drug gnad du 'dus pa'i dbang po lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dag gzhi dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i gzhi yang srog gi dbang po gang yin pa de yin te /
analyzed: de ni skye mched drug gnad du 'dus pa'i dbang po lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dag gzhi dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas te zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i gzhi yang srog gi dbang po gang yin pa de yin te /
translated: The basis of both is the life faculty,

original: de la brten te 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten te 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage in activity in dependence on it.

original: de lta ma yin na don gyi tshul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe tshor ba btang snyoms kyi dbang po yod du zin kyang dbang po 'di gsum kho na bstan pa ni 'di'i don gyi tshul rnam pa gzhan du mi srid pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don gyi tshul med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe tshor ba btang snyoms kyi dbang po yod du zin kyang dbang po 'di gsum kho na bstan pa ni 'di'i don gyi tshul rnam pa gzhan du mi srid pa'i phyir ro
translated: At that time, even though the faculty of equanimity exists, only these three faculties are mentioned because there is no other way to understand the meaning of the text.

original: // ci'i phyir skye mched drug gi nang du 'dus pa kho na bstan gyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: // ci'i phyir skye mched drug gi nang du 'dus pa kho na bstan gyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are only the six sense bases taught as included in name-and-form, and not anything else?

original: ming dang gzugs kyi 'og tu skye mched drug kho na skye ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas so //üîΩdge @151a * //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi 'og tu skye mched drug kho na skye ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas so // dge @151a * //
translated: Because only the six sense bases arise after name-and-form, and not anything else.

original: 'dun phal cher sde pa dag 'don pa /
analyzed: 'dun phal cher sde pa dag 'don pa /
translated: The MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika school has a different recitation:üîΩ‚ÄúDelusion and craving are not abandoned.‚Äù

original: rmongs pa dang ni sred pa dag / ces rgyas par 'byung ba ni rmongs pa dang / sred pa gnyi ga yang ma spangs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang ni sred pa dag / ces rgyas par 'byung ba ni rmongs pa dang / sred pa gnyi ga yang ma spangs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Both delusion and craving are not abandoned.

original: de las skyes pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni ma'i mngal du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni ma'i mngal du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The karmic maturation that arises from them is the state of abiding in the mother‚Äôs womb.

analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni ming yin par bstan te /
translated: Those phenomena that are mental factors are names.

original: 'di ni nur nur po'i gnas skabs na reg pa ji ltar yod pa'i khungs 'dir yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nur nur po'i gnas skabs na reg pa ji ltar yod pa'i khungs 'dir yin no //

original: de gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde dang / gnas brtan gyi mdo sde'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde dang / gnas brtan gyi mdo sde'o //
translated: Both of those are the sutra on entering the womb and the sutra of the elder.

original: kye ma rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i ngang tshul yod pa gang dag yin pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Those who have the nature of abiding in that are called those who abide in the extreme of holding one's own view as supreme.

original: nyi tshe ba tha dad pa de dag gi lung dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nyi tshe ba tha dad pa dag gi lung dang / 'don pa tha dad pa rnams gal te bsdus pa'i rtsa ba nyams pa ma yin na ji ltar lung tha dad pa dang /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba tha dad pa de dag gi lung dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nyi tshe ba tha dad pa dag gi lung dang / 'don pa tha dad pa rnams gal te bsdus pa'i rtsa ba nyams pa ma yin na ji ltar lung tha dad pa dang /
translated: Those who have different limited scriptures and so on means that if the root of the collection is not damaged, then even though the scriptures are different,

analyzed: 'don pa tha dad par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: 'di la ni 'jug pa rnyed pa de bskyed pa'i ched du 'dod pa bzhin byed pa 'ga' yang med do // kha cig tu rtsol ba ni yid la byed pa yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'on te yang 'di snyam du kha cig tu ni rtsol ba ni yid la byed pa yin te /
translated: But there is no one here who, having obtained the attainment of entry, acts as he wishes in order to generate it.üîΩIn some places, effort is attention, and so on.

original: gang du dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa yongs su chod pa'o //
analyzed: gang du dmigs pa dang rnam pa la sogs pa yongs su chod pa'o //
translated: In some places, effort is attention, and in some places, it is the discernment of the object.

original: kha cig tu ni 'jug pa rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'jug pa rnyed pa ste /
translated: In some cases, it is the acquisition of engagement.

original: gang du de yongs su mi chod pa'o //
analyzed: gang du de yongs su mi chod pa'o //
translated: In some cases, it is the non-severance of that which is engaged.

original: de'i phyir kha cig tu gang rtsol ba ni yid la byed pa yin kha cig tu ni 'jug pa rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod ces smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig tu gang rtsol ba ni yid la byed pa yin kha cig tu ni 'jug pa rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod ces smras so //
translated: Therefore, what is the logic in saying that in some cases, mental attention is exertion and in some cases, it is the acquisition of engagement?

original: rtsol ba med na rnam par shes pa de skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on te yang khyod nyid la rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsol ba med na rnam par shes pa de skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on te yang khyod nyid la rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: If you say that consciousness does not arise without exertion, then we will state the logic to you.

original: dmigs pa gang la gang gi rtsol ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i rtsol ba med na rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa de la rnam par shes pa skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la gang gi rtsol ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i rtsol ba med na rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa de la rnam par shes pa skye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: If consciousness does not arise without exertion in regard to a perceptual object, then consciousness does not arise in regard to that perceptual object.

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa gzhan la rtsol ba bya ba las de @153a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa gzhan la rtsol ba bya ba las de @153a * //
translated: When exertion is applied to another perceptual object, then at that time, consciousness does not arise in regard to the former perceptual object.

original: las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa la rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i tshe rtsol ba med par skye ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa la rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i tshe rtsol ba med par skye ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: When consciousness arises in relation to another object, it arises effortlessly.üîΩTherefore, there is no contradiction, because attention generates it and it arises effortlessly.

original: de 'gal ba med de yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa yin la de rtsol ba med pa yang yin no zhes sngar shes par byas so zhes smras te /
analyzed: de 'gal ba med de yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa yin la de rtsol ba med pa yang yin no zhes sngar shes par byas so zhes smras te /
translated: This was explained earlier.

original: de 'gal ba med de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de la rnam par shes pa skye ba 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'gal ba med de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de la rnam par shes pa skye ba 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: There is no contradiction means that the arising of consciousness in relation to that object is not contradictory.

original: yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni de skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni de skyed par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni de skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attention generates it means that it is generated by attention.

original: de rtsol ba med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de la rtsol ba med pa kho na yang yin no //
analyzed: de rtsol ba med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa de la rtsol ba med pa kho na yang yin no //
translated: It arises effortlessly means that it arises effortlessly in relation to that object.

original: yang zhes smos pas ni de rtsol ba dang bcas pa yang yin no zhes khang du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yang zhes smos pas ni de rtsol ba dang bcas pa yang yin no zhes khang du chud par bya'o //
translated: The word also indicates that it also arises with effort.

original: sngar shes par byas so zhes bya ba ni snga kho nar gtan la phab par shes par byas rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: sngar shes par byas so zhes bya ba ni snga kho nar gtan la phab par shes par byas rtogs par byas te /
translated: He has already explained it means that he has already understood it, i.e., he has already ascertained it and understood it.

original: ji ltar de skyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de skyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does it generate it?

original: de skyed par byed pa yin pas de skyed pa'o zhes rgyas par nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag ston pa'i tshe rgyas par byas so //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa yin pas de skyed pa'o zhes rgyas par nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis rnam par shes pa'i yan lag ston pa'i tshe rgyas par byas so //
translated: It generates it, because it causes it to generate. He has already explained this extensively in the section on the link of consciousness in terms of the method of etymological interpretation.

original: khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: khams drug la brten nas ma'i mngal du zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The text continues: ‚ÄúIt is based on the six elements in the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: khams drug ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams drug ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äù The six elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: 'dir ni chos kyi khams ma gsungs pa'i phyir de'i tshe reg pa la sogs pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni chos kyi khams ma gsungs pa'i phyir de'i tshe reg pa la sogs pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the element of mental objects is not mentioned here, contact and the other mental factors do not exist at that time.

original: de'i phyir de bas na de'i tshe khams drug nyid ming dang gzugs yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bas na de'i tshe khams drug nyid ming dang gzugs yin no zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says that at that time, the six elements are name and form.

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde dang 'brel ba'i srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba'i gnas skabs sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams rnams dang 'brel ba'i srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba'i gnas skabs kyi zhes bya ba'i don to // de dang 'brel ba'i srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba'i gnas skabs sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams rnams dang 'brel ba'i srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin its condition‚Äù is in the condition of blood and semen.

original: pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i khams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe element of consciousness in the condition of the intermediate existence connected with it‚Äù is the element of consciousness in the condition of the intermediate existence connected with the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space in the condition of blood and semen.

original: go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes bya ba ni skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bstan to zhes bya ba ni skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is taught in order, the meaning of ‚Äúin order‚Äù is that this person is a six-element being.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi skyes bu yin par bstan te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi skyes bu yin par bstan te /
translated: This teaches that the person is in the condition of name-and-form.

original: gnas skabs gzhan na khams drug pa tsam yin par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan na khams drug pa tsam yin par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible that in another condition he is just a six-element being.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug dang zhes bya ba ni reg @153b pa'i skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yin par bstan to //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug dang zhes bya ba ni reg @153b pa'i skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yin par bstan to //
translated: The six bases of contact are the stage of the six sense bases.

original: yid nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ni tshor ba'i gnas skabs yin par bstan to //üîΩcing don gyi tshul de ltar brtag par bya'am zhes bya ba ni ji ltar reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs na khams de dag nyid nye bar rgyu ba yod mod kyi 'on kyang reg pa'i skye mched drug ces bstan pa dang de bzhin du khams drug gi
analyzed: yid nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad ni tshor ba'i gnas skabs yin par bstan to // cing don gyi tshul de ltar brtag par bya'am zhes bya ba ni ji ltar reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs na khams de dag nyid nye bar rgyu ba yod mod kyi 'on kyang reg pa'i skye mched drug ces bstan pa dang de bzhin du khams drug gi
translated: The eighteen movements of mind are the stage of feeling.üîΩShould the meaning be understood in this way?

original: gnas skabs na gzhan dag kyang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs na gzhan dag kyang yod mod kyi /
translated: Just as, at the stage of the six sense bases, those very elements exist, although the six sense bases are taught, and similarly, at the stage of the six elements, others exist,üîΩbut it is taught that this person is the six elements.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa'o zhes bstan pa dag cing don gyi tshul de ltar brtag par bya'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa'o zhes bstan pa dag cing don gyi tshul de ltar brtag par bya'am /
translated: Should the meaning be understood in this way?

original: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na khams drug tsam kho na skyes bu yin nam /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na khams drug tsam kho na skyes bu yin nam /
translated: At the stage of name and form, is the person just the six elements?

original: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs skyes bu 'di yin par bstan to zhes cing don gyi tshul de ltar brtag par bya'am zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs skyes bu 'di yin par bstan to zhes cing don gyi tshul de ltar brtag par bya'am zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the passage should be investigated in this way: Is it the case that the person is taught to exist in the stage of name-and-form?

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las mjug zad du nang gi sa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni skra dang ba spu dang sen mo la sogs pa rnam par phye ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las mjug zad du nang gi sa'i khams la sogs pa rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni skra dang ba spu dang sen mo la sogs pa rnam par phye ba'o //
translated: Just as in this very s≈´tra, the internal earth element, etc., are distinguished, that is, distinguished as hair, body hair, nails, etc.

original: de bzhin du reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs na shin tu rigs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi skyes bur bstan pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa'i skye mched kyi gnas skabs na shin tu rigs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi skyes bur bstan pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Similarly, it is not the case that the person is taught to exist in the stage of name-and-form, but it is taught that it is quite reasonable to exist in the stage of the bases of contact.

original: gnas skabs gang na yang lus kyi khams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i khams med par zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang na yang lus kyi khams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i khams med par zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: In no stage is there a person without the body element and the form element, etc., that is, without the form, smell, taste, and tactile objects.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa tsam ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas yin par gang du yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na ji ltar lus dang gzugs la sogs pa yod pa la sa'i khams la sogs pa tsam bstan pa de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa yod pa la rnam par shes pa'i khams tsam bstan pa yin pas ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na reg
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams la sogs pa tsam ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas yin par gang du yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro // de bas na ji ltar lus dang gzugs la sogs pa yod pa la sa'i khams la sogs pa tsam bstan pa de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa yod pa la rnam par shes pa'i khams tsam bstan pa yin pas ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na reg
translated: The mere elements of earth, etc. are not seen anywhere as the basis of consciousness.

original: pa la sogs pa med par 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa med par 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, just as the mere elements of earth, etc. are taught in the existence of the body and form, etc., the mere element of consciousness is taught in the existence of contact, etc. Thus, contact, etc. are established as not existing in the state of name-and-form.üîΩThis is not the meaning of this sutra.

original: mdo sde 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni der go rims bzhin no zhes rgyas par bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni der go rims bzhin no zhes rgyas par bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the order there.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir khams la sogs pa gsum smos she na zhes bya ba ni gal te don 'di ma yin na khams la sogs pa zhes bya ba reg pa'i skye mched dang yid nye bar rgyu ba dang rnam pa gnyis dang gsum ci'i phyir smos she naüîΩ/ de'i phyir gnas dang gnas pa bstan @154a * //

translated: If this is not the meaning, then why are the two, the bases of contact and the mental applications, and the three, the elements and so on, mentioned?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /

original: gnas bstan pa'i phyir dang / gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas bstan pa'i phyir dang / gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de yang yid nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi gnas yin te zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i skye mched la bya ste /
analyzed: de yang yid nye bar rgyu ba rnams kyi gnas yin te zhes bya ba'i don te / de yang zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i skye mched la bya ste /
translated: That means the bases of contact.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: gnas yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The basis. This is the meaning in context.

original: lus la khams so sor brtag par bya ba ni bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir ci zhe na /
analyzed: lus la khams so sor brtag par bya ba ni bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir ci zhe na /

original: khams smos pa yin no //
analyzed: khams smos pa yin no //
translated: The elements.

translated: Because the two sense bases of body and mind exist during the state of name and form.

original: drug char gyi yang gnyi ga tshogs pa yin te zhes bya ba @154b ni skye mched drug car gyi rkyen yang ming dang gzugs tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: drug char gyi yang gnyi ga tshogs pa yin te zhes bya ba @154b ni skye mched drug car gyi rkyen yang ming dang gzugs tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe combination of both‚Äù refers to the fact that the combination of name and form is the condition for the six sense bases.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩlus dang sems gnyis gcig la gcig rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / lus dang sems gnyis gcig la gcig rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: How is that?üîΩBecause the body and mind are seen to follow each other.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i rjes su byed pa yin la lus dang sems gnyis kyang gcig la gcig rjes su byed par snang ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i rjes su byed pa yin la lus dang sems gnyis kyang gcig la gcig rjes su byed par snang ste /
translated: The effect follows the cause, and the body and mind are seen to follow each other.

original: de bas na lus ni sems kyi rgyu yin la sems kyang lus kyi yin par grub ste nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lus ni sems kyi rgyu yin la sems kyang lus kyi yin par grub ste nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established that the body is the cause of the mind and the mind is the cause of the body.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi gzugs ni skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyi yid kyi rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs kyi gzugs ni skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyi yid kyi rgyu yang yin la /
translated: The form that is the condition of name-and-form is the cause of the mind that is the condition of the six sense bases.

original: ming ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: ming ni mig la sogs pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: Name is the cause of the eye sense base, etc.

original: skrag pa dang mya ngan dang dga' ba dang / nad dang rga ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba ni skrag pa dang mya ngan dang dga' ba'i gnas skabs na lus ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: skrag pa dang mya ngan dang dga' ba dang / nad dang rga ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba ni skrag pa dang mya ngan dang dga' ba'i gnas skabs na lus ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: In the states of fear, grief, joy, sickness, and aging, the body follows the mind.

original: skrag na lus 'dar ba dang rengs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skrag na lus 'dar ba dang rengs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In fear, the body trembles and becomes rigid.

original: mya ngan gyis nyam thag pa na lus myogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis nyam thag pa na lus myogs pa'o //
translated: In grief, the body is emaciated.

original: dga' na bde ba dang mig me tog kha bye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dga' na bde ba dang mig me tog kha bye ba lta bu'o //
translated: In joy, the body is happy and the eyes are like open flowers.

original: nad dang rga ba'i gnas skabs na sems ni lus kyi rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: nad dang rga ba'i gnas skabs na sems ni lus kyi rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: In the states of sickness and aging, the mind follows the body.

original: nad kyis nyen na sems 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad kyis nyen na sems 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When afflicted by sickness, the mind becomes disturbed.

original: rgas na dran pa chung zhing shes rab zhan pa'o //
analyzed: rgas na dran pa chung zhing shes rab zhan pa'o //
translated: When old, memory is weak and wisdom is feeble.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ngal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ngal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood to include the states of fatigue, etc., and the states of childhood, etc.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir phyi'i skye mched drug gi rkyen 'dir ma bstan ce na /üîΩde ni yan lag tha dad par yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la de ni zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched drug gzugs la sogs pa nas chos kyi skye mched la thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir phyi'i skye mched drug gi rkyen 'dir ma bstan ce na / de ni yan lag tha dad par yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la de ni zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched drug gzugs la sogs pa nas chos kyi skye mched la thug pa rnams so //
translated: Why is the condition of the six external sense bases not mentioned here?üîΩIt is not a separate member because it exists in the first moment of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na yang de yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched drug de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na yang de yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni phyi'i skye mched drug de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The six external sense bases exist because name-and-form exists.

original: ming dang gzugs kyang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de'i rkyen yin par bstan zin to zhes ston te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de'i rkyen yin par bstan zin to zhes ston te /
translated: Name-and-form is also taught to be a condition.

original: ming gzugs kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming gzugs kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in name-and-form.üîΩSound is not mentioned as a condition because its stage is not fixed;

original: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sam skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs nges pa yang yod pa ma yin pas de'i rkyen du ma
analyzed: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sam skye mched drug gi gnas skabs yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs nges pa yang yod pa ma yin pas de'i rkyen du ma
translated: that is, it is not fixed that it exists in the stage of kalala, etc., or in the stage of the six sense spheres.

original: bstan to // gnas skabs nges pa'i rkyen ni 'dir bstan to //
analyzed: bstan to // gnas skabs nges pa'i rkyen ni 'dir bstan to //
translated: A condition whose stage is fixed is mentioned here.

original: lnga po yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga po yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gzugs dang sgra @155a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra @155a * //
translated: The sense bases of form, sound,

original: dang dri dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams ni /
analyzed: dang dri dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams ni /
translated: smell, and tactility.

original: gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These five are not included in the number of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams kyi rkyen ni 'dir bstan to //üîΩ'di'i phyir yang rkyen ma bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams kyi rkyen ni 'dir bstan to //üîΩ'di'i phyir yang rkyen ma bstan to //
translated: A condition that is included in the number of sentient beings is mentioned here.üîΩSound is not mentioned as a condition because it is not included in the number of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yang rkyen yin par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate wisdom, mindfulness, attention, aspiration,

original: mos pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mos pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: resolution, and so on.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: chos kyi skye mched sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams kyi rkyen yin par bstan zin to //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnams kyi rkyen yin par bstan zin to //
translated: It is already explained that it is a condition of those phenomena that are included in the phenomena base and belong to sentient beings.

original: ji ltar reg pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yin par bstan ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar reg pa la sogs pa'i rkyen yin par bstan ce na /
translated: How is it explained that it is a condition of contact and so on?

original: ji ltar ming dang gzugs ni skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyi yid kyi skye mched kyi rkyen yin pa de bzhin du de dang mtshungs par ldan pa reg pa la sogs pa chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa rnams kyi yang rkyen yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ming dang gzugs ni skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyi yid kyi skye mched kyi rkyen yin pa de bzhin du de dang mtshungs par ldan pa reg pa la sogs pa chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa rnams kyi yang rkyen yin no //
translated: Just as name and form are a condition of the mental faculty that is included in the six bases, so too they are a condition of contact and so on that are concomitant with it and belong to the phenomena base.

original: ming dang gzugs la nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag dbye ba las so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag dbye ba las so //
translated: It has already been explained that this is because name-and-form has specific powers.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: las kyi khyad par las rnam par shes pa khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi khyad par las rnam par shes pa khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness becomes specific due to the specific actions of beings.

original: de las ming dang gzugs khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ming dang gzugs khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Name-and-form becomes specific due to that.

original: de las skye mched drug gi'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de las skye mched drug gi'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The six sense bases become specific due to that.üîΩIf the six sense bases were a condition of name-and-form alone, the consciousness of those born supernaturally would not be a condition of name-and-form.

original: gal te ming dang gzugs kho na'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi de'i rkyen rnam par shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te rkyen nges par byed de ming dang gzugs kho na skye mched drugüîΩgi rkyen yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te ming dang gzugs kho na'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi de'i rkyen rnam par shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te rkyen nges par byed de ming dang gzugs kho na skye mched drugüîΩgi rkyen yin gyi /
translated: If the six sense bases were a condition of name-and-form alone, the consciousness of those born supernaturally would not be a condition of name-and-form.

original: gzhan ma yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi skye mched drug gi rkyen ming dang gzugs yin zhes bya bar ming dang gzugs sogs shin tu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin na ni rdzus te byung ba rnams kyi skye mched drug gi rkyen ming dang gzugs yin zhes bya bar ming dang gzugs sogs shin tu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not different, then the six sense bases of those who are born supernaturally would not be conditioned by name and form, because name and form are completely undifferentiated.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin no //
translated: It is conditioned by consciousness.

original: 'on te skye mched drug kho na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin na ni de dag la gnas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug la gnas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rkyen ming dang gzugs maüîΩyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te skye mched drug kho na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin na ni de dag la gnas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug la gnas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rkyen ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the six sense bases are conditioned by name and form, then the form that exists in them would not be conditioned by name and form, because the form that exists in the six sense bases is the characteristic of the combination of the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: yid kyi skye mched dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos @155b reg pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos @155b reg pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The name and form that is the condition of the mental faculty and the phenomena element would not exist, because the phenomena element is not form.üîΩThe name and form that is the condition of the contact that is associated with the mental faculty would not exist.

original: sgra'i skye mched de yang gnas skabs ma nges pa'i phyir skye mched drug gi gnas skabs na yang yod pas de'i rkyen yang ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur te gal te rkyen can nges par byed de skye mched drug kho na'i rkyen ming dang gzugs yin gyi
analyzed: sgra'i skye mched de yang gnas skabs ma nges pa'i phyir skye mched drug gi gnas skabs na yang yod pas de'i rkyen yang ming dang gzugs ma yin par 'gyur te gal te rkyen can nges par byed de skye mched drug kho na'i rkyen ming dang gzugs yin gyi
translated: If you say that the conditioned is ascertained, then name and form are the condition of the six sense bases alone,

original: gzhan gyi ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin pas so //
translated: but not of others.

original: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas skabs bcu gnyis yod pa yin pas skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas skabs bcu gnyis yod pa yin pas skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of the complete stage of birth is the twelve abodes.

original: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs de'i gang zag gi ched du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug go zhes rkyen bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs de'i gang zag gi ched du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug go zhes rkyen bshad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The condition is explained for the person in that state of the complete stage of birth, since name and form are the condition of the six sense bases.

original: 'dis ni rkyen nges pa bsal ba yin te skye ba'i rim pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rkyen nges pa bsal ba yin te skye ba'i rim pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis skye mched drug yin no //
translated: This passage explains the ascertainment of conditions, for the six sense bases are a condition for consciousness at the stage when the process of birth is not yet complete.

original: yan lag tha dad pa yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag tha dad pa yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the members?

original: rkyen bshad pa'i phyir zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rkyen bshad pa'i phyir zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that of the explanation of conditions.

original: 'dis ni rkyen bsal to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rkyen bsal to //
translated: This passage explains the ascertainment of conditions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yan lag tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yan lag tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the form, etc., that exist in that stage are not different members,

original: sngon med pa'i rdzas gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i rdzas gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: because it is impossible for another substance to exist that did not exist previously.

original: de la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na yod do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na yod do //
translated: The form, etc., that exist in that stage exist in the state of name-and-form.

original: de'i phyir skye mched drug gi gnas skabs na sngon med pa'i rdzas gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched drug gi gnas skabs na sngon med pa'i rdzas gzhan med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the state of the six sense bases, another substance that did not exist previously does not exist.

original: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi gnas skabs na sngon ma byung ba'i sgra lan 'ga' zhig yod du zin kyang de'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par mi brjod de /
analyzed: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi gnas skabs na sngon ma byung ba'i sgra lan 'ga' zhig yod du zin kyang de'i ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par mi brjod de /
translated: Even though sound that did not exist previously may occur at the time of the six sense spheres, it is not said to be a condition of name-and-form.

original: de ni gal te na ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni gal te na ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na yang yod pa yin te /
translated: If it were, then sound would exist at the time of name-and-form,

original: gnas skabs ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a fixed condition.

original: 'dir ni gnas skabs nges pa'i rkyen bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnas skabs nges pa'i rkyen bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the fixed condition is taught as a condition.

original: skye mched drug gis bsdus pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa rnams bcu drug 'dir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: skye mched drug gis bsdus pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa rnams bcu drug 'dir bstan pa yin te /
translated: The meaning subsumed by the six sense spheres is taught here in sixteen topics.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The presentation of the divisions is as follows:

original: nang gi skye mched drug ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: The six internal sense spheres are taught.

original: sgra sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du drug nyid skye mched @156a * //
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du drug nyid skye mched @156a * //
translated: The presentation of the application of the term is as follows:

original: yin pas skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: yin pas skye mched drug ste /
translated: Because of being six sense spheres, they are the six sense spheres.

original: ji ltar sa gsum dang 'bras bu gsum dang tsha ba gsum lta bu'o zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩthun mong ma yin pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sa gsum dang 'bras bu gsum dang tsha ba gsum lta bu'o zhes bstan pa yin no // thun mong ma yin pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, the three worlds, the three fruits, and the three hot things.

original: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The uncommon presentation is as follows: Form and so on are not the bases because they are shared with the mindstreams of others.

original: de'i don rnam par gzhag pa ni gnas kyi don ni skye mched yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don rnam par gzhag pa ni gnas kyi don ni skye mched yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is presented as follows: The meaning of base is sense base.

original: nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched de zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug rnams skye ba mched par byed pas skye mched de zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The etymological definition is presented as follows: The six collections of consciousnesses are sense bases because they cause the arising of consciousness.

original: rang gi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs dang ba'i bye brag can mig la sogs pa lnga yin no zhes bya ba dang / yid kyi skye mched ni phung po'i nang du ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa'o zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du gzugs dang ba'i bye brag can mig la sogs pa lnga yin no zhes bya ba dang / yid kyi skye mched ni phung po'i nang du ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang yin pa'o zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The presentation of their own natures is as follows: ‚ÄúThe five beginning with the eye are natures that are particular instances of form.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe sense-sphere of the mental faculty is the aggregate of consciousness within the aggregates.‚Äù

original: nges pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The presentation of their ascertainment is as follows:

original: thams cad kyi skye mched drug gi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par nges par bya'o ming dang gzugs thams cad sprin las char la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi skye mched drug gi dang po ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis yin par nges par bya'o ming dang gzugs thams cad sprin las char la sogs pa bzhin du skye mched drug gi rkyen ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe first of all the six sense-spheres is ascertained to have the condition of name-and-form. All name-and-form is not the condition of the six sense-spheres, like clouds, rain, and so on.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du ;
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du ;
translated: The presentation of the conditions for their establishment and completion is as follows:

original: mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par sbyar te zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs par sbyar te zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi rten gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The presentation of the basis of the six collections of consciousness is as follows.üîΩThe primary cause is as previously explained.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i ji skad du sngar bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu yin pa'i ji skad du sngar bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no ;
translated: The presentation of ascertainment is as follows.üîΩSome think that in the stage of name and form, the body exists, but since it is not clear, it is not ascertained.

original: / rnam par nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du kha cig rtog pa ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus yod kyang zhes bya ba nas de bas na thog ma kho nar mngal du phung po lnga pa'i ming dang gzugs grub pa yin noüîΩzhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / rnam par nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du kha cig rtog pa ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs na lus yod kyang zhes bya ba nas de bas na thog ma kho nar mngal du phung po lnga pa'i ming dang gzugs grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, first in the womb, the five aggregates of name and form are established.

original: 'dus pa rkyen yin par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: 'dus pa rkyen yin par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /

original: drug car gyi yang gnyi ga tshogs pa yin te zhes bya ba nas lus dang sems gnyis gcig la gcig rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: drug car gyi yang gnyi ga tshogs pa yin te zhes bya ba nas lus dang sems gnyis gcig la gcig rjes su byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The combination of both body and mind is the sixth, because it is seen that the body and mind are mutually dependent.

original: yan lag gzhan rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du //
analyzed: yan lag gzhan rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du //
translated: The other members are established as follows:

original: phyi'i skye mched las @156b brtsams nas de ni yan lag tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched las @156b brtsams nas de ni yan lag tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi skad cig ma dang po'i tshe na yang de yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: gnas skabs nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: gnas skabs nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /

analyzed: sgra yang gnas skabs ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Sound is not definite as a state.üîΩThe members are established as belonging to the number of sentient beings, as it is said:

original: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du lnga po yang gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du lnga po yang gcig kho nar sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: rkyen mtha' dang bral ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: rkyen mtha' dang bral ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The presentation of the condition that is free from the extremes is taught by the statement:

analyzed: ming dang gzugs la nus pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: ma nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: ma nges pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The presentation of the indeterminate is taught by the statement:

original: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ched du rkyen bshad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yan lag tha dad pa yang zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi ched du rkyen bshad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yan lag tha dad pa yang zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: skye mched drug rgya cher bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skye mched drug rgya cher bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The extensive explanation of the six sense bases is complete.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúConditioned by the six sense bases is contact‚Äù ‚Äî what is contact? The word contact is seen in three ways:

analyzed: // / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba'i reg pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i reg pa'i sgra 'di ni reg bya la yang mthong /

original: phrad pa la yang mthong /
analyzed: phrad pa la yang mthong /
translated: as the meeting of three, and

original: sems las byung ba la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba la yang mthong ste /

original: gsung rab las rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsung rab las rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug ces 'byung ngo //

original: de dmigs kyis dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dmigs kyis dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to distinguish it,üîΩthe six collections of contact are taught.

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas reg pa'i rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas rab tu dbye ba bstan gyi zhes smras te /
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas reg pa'i rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas rab tu dbye ba bstan gyi zhes smras te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught the classification of contact from the perspective of different bases for contact in dependence on the specific trainees.

original: mig la sogs pa rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du yin gyi /
translated: From the perspective of different bases such as the eyes, there are six types of contact, from contact through the coming together of eye and so on up to contact through the coming together of mind and so on.

analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //

original: gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas kyang gsungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas kyang gsungs pa ma yin te /
translated: In dependence on the specific trainees, the BhagavƒÅn taught the classification of contact from the perspective of different bases for contact.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du ma dris par 'chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rab tu dbye ba ni dris pa yin pas so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du ma dris par 'chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rab tu dbye ba ni dris pa yin pas so //
translated: because it would follow that one would explain without being asked, and because the classification is a question.

original: gsum pa 'dus byas pas reg pa yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩming dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam @157a * //
analyzed: gsum pa 'dus byas pas reg pa yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na / ming dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam @157a * //
translated: The third is contact, as stated in another s≈´tra: ‚ÄúConditioned by the three, contact occurs.‚Äù

original: par shes pa skye'o //üîΩgsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o 'byung ba'i mdo sde las kyang /
analyzed: par shes pa skye'o // gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'o 'byung ba'i mdo sde las kyang /
translated: Name-and-form is a condition for the arising of eye consciousness.üîΩThe coming together of the three is contact.üîΩThe S≈´tra on the Origin of the World also says, ‚ÄúThe coming together of the three is contact.‚Äù

original: gsum 'dus pa las zhes bya ba ni rgyu bstan pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las zhes bya ba ni rgyu bstan pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gang la brten nas sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad skye'o zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad skyed par byed pa'i sgo nas reg pa bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by the six sense bases, contact occurs‚Äù teaches contact as the door for the arising of all mental factors.

original: byed pa de yang mngon sum mam /
analyzed: byed pa de yang mngon sum mam /
translated: This activity is either direct or indirect.

original: rjes su dpag pas mi 'grub pas de bas na ji skad du dris pa bcu'i mdo sde las zhes bya ba nas gang yin pa de thams cad reg pa la brten nas so zhes bya ba'i dbang du gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas mi 'grub pas de bas na ji skad du dris pa bcu'i mdo sde las zhes bya ba nas gang yin pa de thams cad reg pa la brten nas so zhes bya ba'i dbang du gsungs so //
translated: Since it is not established by inference, therefore, as it is said in the S≈´tra on the Ten Questions, ‚ÄúAll of that is based on contact.‚Äù

analyzed: de yid kyis 'ga' yang yongs su mi chod do zhes bya ba ni reg pa 'di'o //

original: de'i tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / sems pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'os pa rang gi mtshan nyid yid kyis yongs su chod pa yin gyi /

original: de ltar reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar reg pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod do zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yid ches par bya zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir yid brtan du rung ba'i lung las so zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúfrom reliable testimony.‚Äù

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa gsum 'dus pa las reg pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni /

translated: And whatever is the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of conception, the aggregate of formations, all that is feeling based on contact.

original: 'dir smra ba yid kyis yongs su mi chod pa yin na yid brtan du rung ba'i lung tsam gyis yod par ji ltar yid ches par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir smra ba yid kyis yongs su mi chod pa yin na yid brtan du rung ba'i lung tsam gyis yod par ji ltar yid ches par bya zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir yid brtan du rung ba'i lung yang rnam pa gsum ste /

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya pa'i don ni bram ze'i khye'u 'di lta ste mdog ngan par 'gro ba'i lam ni 'di dag ste / 'di lta ste kha cig khro ba yin /
translated: The meaning to be inferred is: ‚ÄúThe path of the young brahmin is bad,

original: 'khrug pa mang ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩdad par bya ba'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa mang ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no // dad par bya ba'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: for he is angry, he is quarrelsome, and so on.üîΩ‚Äù

original: @157b rnam pa gsum gyi gnas kyis byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro /

translated: The meaning to be believed is: ‚ÄúThe people of Uttarakuru, the gods of the Thirty-three, and the people of Jambudvipa surpass others in three ways.

original: gsum po gang gis she na /
analyzed: gsum po gang gis she na /

analyzed: bdag gi ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / tshe nges pa dang / nges par khyad par du 'gro ba'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They are without ‚Äòmine‚Äô and without grasping, their life span is definite, and they are definitely progressing.‚Äù

original: yid brtan du rung ba'i lung rnam pa gsum po de la mngon sum gyi don dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don gnyis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: yid brtan du rung ba'i lung rnam pa gsum po de la mngon sum gyi don dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don gnyis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du yid ches par bya ste /
translated: The three kinds of authoritative statements are to be believed in the following order: the meaning of the direct perception and the meaning of the inference are to be believed in the order of the two, direct perception and inference.

analyzed: gang de dag dang 'gal ba med pa mngon sum gyi don gyi tshig la ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i sgo nas so //

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //

analyzed: tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin /

analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba lnga nas med pa zhes bya ba yin no //

translated: the meaning of the characteristic of not being ascertained should be understood from the scriptures that are reliable sources of valid knowledge.

original: lung yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of being reliable is that it is a reliable scripture.

original: de dag ni rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gsum po rnams phrad pa dang / tshogs pa dang 'dus pa ni reg pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gsum po rnams phrad pa dang / tshogs pa dang 'dus pa ni reg pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: de bas na de la reg pa btags pa yin no //

original: dper na / 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
analyzed: dper na / 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //

analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i dri ma 'dod chags kyi rgyu yin pas tshangs par spyod pa'i dri ma zhes bshad do //

original: 'jig rten na yang me ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang me ni bde ba'o //
