translated: Because the six sense bases are the primary condition in the s≈´tra on dependent origination,

original: mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes reg pa bstan pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro la sogs pa'i sog nas gzugs kyi 'dus te reg pa nas chos kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes reg pa bstan pa yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro la sogs pa'i sog nas gzugs kyi 'dus te reg pa nas chos kyi 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: The contact of eye, etc. is taught by way of the eye, etc., not by way of form, etc.

original: rnga sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: rnga sgra bzhin no //
translated: It is like the sound of a drum.

original: dper na rnga ni rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rnga'i sgra zhes brjod kyi dbyu gu'i sgra zhes mi bya ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga ni rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir rnga'i sgra zhes brjod kyi dbyu gu'i sgra zhes mi bya ba de bzhin no //
translated: For example, a drum is called the sound of a drum because it is the principal cause of the sound. It is not called the sound of the drumstick.

original: rnga sgra de'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa yang de'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnga sgra de'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin pa yang de'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The drum is the principal cause of the sound of the drum because it is the basis of the sound and because it is the uncommon cause.

original: dbyu gu la sogs pas ni cang te'u la sogs pa'i sgra'i rgyu yang byed do //
analyzed: dbyu gu la sogs pas ni cang te'u la sogs pa'i sgra'i rgyu yang byed do //
translated: The drumstick, etc. are also the cause of the sound of the drum, etc.

original: de bzhin du skye mched drug ni reg pa'i rkyen gyi gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched drug ni reg pa'i rkyen gyi gtso bo yin no //
translated: In the same way, the six sense spheres are the principal condition of contact.

original: sgrib pa'i mdo sde las gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa zhes ji skad du rgyas par gsungs pa la rten dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i mdo sde las gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa zhes ji skad du rgyas par gsungs pa la rten dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rten tha dad pa'i sgo nas dang / dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin terms of different supports and different objects‚Äù means in terms of different supports and different objects.üîΩHow does the S≈´tra on Obstructions state that contact has two conditions?

original: sgrib pa'i mdo sde las reg pa'i rkyen gnyis su ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: sgrib pa'i mdo sde las reg pa'i rkyen gnyis su ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: It says:

original: ji skad du dge slong dag byis pa ma rig pas bsgribs shing sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di grub ste /
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag byis pa ma rig pas bsgribs shing sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di grub ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, this body, which is formed with consciousness and is associated with craving and obscured by ignorance,

original: 'di'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di dang phyi ma'i ming dang gzugs te @160a * //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'di dang phyi ma'i ming dang gzugs te @160a * //
translated: and this name-and-form, which is associated with consciousness, are two.

original: de ltar gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis so //
translated: In this way, there are two.

original: dge slong dag gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag gnyis po 'di la brten nas reg pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Monks, based on these two, there is contact.‚Äù

original: 'di las ji ltar rten dang dmigs pa can gyi reg pa tha dad par bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'di las ji ltar rten dang dmigs pa can gyi reg pa tha dad par bstan ce na /
translated: How does this passage teach that contact has different supports and different objects?

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyis ni der nang gi skye mched bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyis ni der nang gi skye mched bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the internal sense bases are taught by the body that possesses consciousness.

original: lus smos pas ni lnga char smos pa yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: lus smos pas ni lnga char smos pa yin no zhes smras so //
translated: And by mentioning the body, all five are mentioned.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar de la brten pa'i tshor ba ni lus kyi zhes ston pa bzhin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar de la brten pa'i tshor ba ni lus kyi zhes ston pa bzhin no zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúFeeling that is based on that is bodily feeling.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la brten pa'i phyir dang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir lus smos pas ni lnga char smos pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / lus la brten pa'i phyir dang rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir lus smos pas ni lnga char smos pa yin no //
translated: All five are mentioned by mentioning the body because it is a part of the body, it is based on the body, and it is an aggregation of subtle particles.

original: rnam par shes pa smos pas ni skye mched yin par ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smos pas ni skye mched yin par ro //
translated: By mentioning consciousness, the sense bases are mentioned.

original: phyi rol gyi ming dang gzugs ni phyi yin te zhes bya ba ji zhe na /üîΩskye mched drug bstan pa yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ming dang gzugs ni phyi yin te zhes bya ba ji zhe na / skye mched drug bstan pa yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: What is external form?üîΩThe six sense bases are taught.

original: de la mig gis ni chos kyi skye mched bstan to //
analyzed: de la mig gis ni chos kyi skye mched bstan to //
translated: The eye sense faculty is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe eye sense base.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyis ni gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyis ni gzugs kyi skye mched la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Form is taught by the form base, etc.

original: gnyis po de dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang phyi'i zhes ston to //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang phyi'i zhes ston to //
translated: The two are taught by the six internal bases and the six external bases.üîΩThe six bases of contact are taught in the Collection of Middle Length Discourses.

original: de las gsungs pa zhes bya ba mod sde las reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag gang gis reg pa'i byis pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched tha dad pa'i sog nas reg pa 'byung gi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gsungs pa zhes bya ba mod sde las reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag gang gis reg pa'i byis pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched tha dad pa'i sog nas reg pa 'byung gi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The intention behind the explanation of the six bases of contact is that contact arises from the internal and external bases, not from anything else.

original: dgongs pa gang gis bshad pa de dag bdag gis smras zin to zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dgongs pa gang gis bshad pa de dag bdag gis smras zin to zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na /
translated: I have already explained the intention behind the explanation of the six bases of contact.

original: skye mched drug ni gtso bo'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir skye mched drug rkyen du bstan pa dang / rten dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas reg pa tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir rkyen gnyis smras so //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni gtso bo'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir skye mched drug rkyen du bstan pa dang / rten dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas reg pa tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir rkyen gnyis smras so //
translated: The six bases of contact are taught as a condition because they are the principal condition. Two conditions are mentioned because contact is taught to be different in terms of different supports and different focal objects.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gsum yang 'dod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gsum yang 'dod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The three conditions for contact are asserted to be desire and so on.

original: de bas na 'di 'chad pa'i bsam pa'i dbye ba phyis yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'chad pa'i bsam pa'i dbye ba phyis yang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the classification of the intention to explain this should not be mentioned again later.

original: gang gi phyir skye mched drug gi 'og tu rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye mched drug gi 'og tu rnam par gzhag ce na zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Why is it established after the six sense bases? It is because the condition of the six sense bases is contact, and the condition of contact is feeling.

original: skye mched drug gi 'og tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi 'og tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated after the six sense bases.

original: ji ltar lus dang yid kyi skye mched gnyis de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag gzhan du rnam par ma bzhag pa ltar reg pa dang tshor ba gnyis kyang de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan @160b lag gzhan nyid du rnam par mi gzhag go
analyzed: ji ltar lus dang yid kyi skye mched gnyis de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag gzhan du rnam par ma bzhag pa ltar reg pa dang tshor ba gnyis kyang de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan @160b lag gzhan nyid du rnam par mi gzhag go
translated: Just as the two sense bases of body and mind are not established as separate limbs because they are complete at that time, so contact and feeling are not established as separate limbs because they are complete at that time.

original: // gal te skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin na /
analyzed: // gal te skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin na /
translated: If the condition of the six sense bases is contact, and the condition of contact is feeling,

original: rgyu chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs rkyen du gsungs she na zhes bya ba ji skad 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs rkyen du gsungs she na zhes bya ba ji skad 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why does the Great Vehicle state that name and form are conditions?

original: kun dga' bo reg pa reg pa'i rkyen du brjod par bya ba yo do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo reg pa reg pa'i rkyen du brjod par bya ba yo do //
translated: ‚Äú Ananda, contact is said to be a condition for contact.

original: kun dga' bo reg pa reg pa'i rkyen du brjod par bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo reg pa reg pa'i rkyen du brjod par bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Ananda, what is contact that is said to be a condition for contact?

original: kun dga' bo ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis reg pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis reg pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Ananda, it is contact that has name and form as its condition.

original: der ni thogs pa dang tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu chen po'i rnam grags kyi mdo sde las /
analyzed: der ni thogs pa dang tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu chen po'i rnam grags kyi mdo sde las /
translated: Here, contact is said to be a condition for contact because it is asserted that contact is a combination of obstruction and designation.

original: thogs pa 'dus te reg pa ni dbang po gzugs can lnga la brten pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa 'dus te reg pa ni dbang po gzugs can lnga la brten pa'o //
translated: Obstructional contact is said to be based on the five physical sense faculties.

original: tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa ni drug pa yid kyi dbang po la brten pa yin par brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa ni drug pa yid kyi dbang po la brten pa yin par brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Designation contact is said to be based on the sixth, the mental faculty.

original: mig la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir thogs pa 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po la brten pa'i phyir thogs pa 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Contact through the coming together of eye, etc., is called contact through obstruction because it is based on the sense faculties that are obstructed.

original: tshig la brten nas don la 'jug pa ni tshig bla dags pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshig la brten nas don la 'jug pa ni tshig bla dags pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Contact through designation is taught because one engages the object by means of the word.

original: yang na tshig lhag par byed pa'i yid ni tshig bla dags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshig lhag par byed pa'i yid ni tshig bla dags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the mind that makes words predominant is called contact through designation.

original: de bas na yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni tshig bla dags 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, contact through the coming together of the mind is called contact through designation.

original: de la gzugs kyi rkyen gyis 'dus te reg pa dang mig gi rkyen gyis 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi rkyen gyis 'dus te reg pa dang mig gi rkyen gyis 'dus te reg pa zhes bstan to //
translated: In this regard, contact through the coming together of the eye is taught as a condition of form, and contact through the coming together of the eye is taught as a condition of form.

original: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs de las skye mched drug rkyen nyid yin pa yang bstan zin te /
analyzed: rgyu chen po'i rnam grangs de las skye mched drug rkyen nyid yin pa yang bstan zin te /
translated: From that enumeration of great causes, the six sense bases are also taught as conditions.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir / mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mig gi 'dus te reg pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that because contact through the coming together of the eye, etc., is taught.

original: kun dga' bo gal te mig gi 'dus te reg pa yod kyang 'ga' la gang du mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang du tshor ba bde ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te mig gi 'dus te reg pa yod kyang 'ga' la gang du mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis nang du tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Ananda, if there is eye contact, but in some cases, the condition of eye contact does not produce internally a feeling that is pleasant,üîΩpainful,

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: or neither pleasant nor painful,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa mi 'byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa mi 'byung ba yin nam /
translated: is there or is there not eye contact?

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, Lord.‚Äù

original: kun dga' bo rna ba dang sna dang lce dang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yod kyang 'ga' la gang du yang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyi nang du tshor ba bde ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rna ba dang sna dang lce dang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa yod kyang 'ga' la gang du yang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyi nang du tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Ananda, if there is ear, nose, tongue, or body contact, but in some cases, the condition of body contact does not produce internally a feeling that is pleasant,üîΩpainful,

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: or neither pleasant nor painful,

original: sdug bsngal pa yang ma yin pa mi 'byung ba yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal pa yang ma yin pa mi 'byung ba yin nam /
translated: is there or is there not body contact?

original: btsun pa ma lags so zhes rgyas par 'byung pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so zhes rgyas par 'byung pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, Lord.‚Äù
But if there is eye contact,

original: yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa zhes gsungs na 'dus pa zhes bya ba de ci yin zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan pa'i phyir ci 'di yul gcig tu tshogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang gsum 'dus pa las reg pa zhes gsungs na 'dus pa zhes bya ba de ci yin zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan pa'i phyir ci 'di yul gcig tu tshogs pa yin nam /
translated: If contact is said to be the coming together of the three, what is this coming together?

original: 'on te dus gcig tu tshogs pa yin pa dmigs kyis mi phyed do //
analyzed: 'on te dus gcig tu tshogs pa yin pa dmigs kyis mi phyed do //
translated: Since the characteristic of coming together is not explained, it is not distinguished whether it is the coming together of objects in one place or the coming together of objects in one time.üîΩIf someone asserts that it is the coming together of some other object, then if you think that coming together is a collection,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig 'dir 'dus pa yin par 'dod nas tshogs pa yin no zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa ni 'dus pa yin no snyam sems na de la de dag gi tshogs pa yul du 'am /üîΩdus su 'am /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig 'dir 'dus pa yin par 'dod nas tshogs pa yin no zhe na yang zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa ni 'dus pa yin no snyam sems na de la de dag gi tshogs pa yul du 'am / dus su 'am /
translated: you should say whether that collection is in a place,

original: gzhan du yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: in time, or in something else.

original: gal te lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If you say it is because they arise together, that means they are born at the same time.

original: de ltar yin na dbang po dang don gnyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na dbang po dang don gnyis rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the two, the sense faculty and object, would not be the cause of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes zin na ni de gnyis nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de yang de dag dang lhan cig skyes pa yin na ni bdag nyid thob pa de la de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dbang po dang don gnyisüîΩkyi nus pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes zin na ni de gnyis nus pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de yang de dag dang lhan cig skyes pa yin na ni bdag nyid thob pa de la de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dbang po dang don gnyis kyi nus pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If they arise simultaneously with it, it is illogical that the two, the sense faculty and object, have the potential to generate that which has already been obtained.

original: 'o na ma skyes pa de la de bskyed par nus pa de gnyis la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ma skyes pa de la de bskyed par nus pa de gnyis la yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that those two have the potential to generate that which has not yet arisen,

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa yin na yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa yin na yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: then it is said that even if it has not arisen, it does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa de la ni dbang po dang don de gnyis nus pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa de la ni dbang po dang don de gnyis nus pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because if consciousness has not yet arisen, those two, the sense faculty and object, do not have the potential.

original: ma skyes pa de la nus pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ma skyes pa de la nus pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What potential can exist in that which has not arisen?

original: de mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid thob pa ni bdag nyid thob par bya'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid thob pa ni bdag nyid thob par bya'i rgyur rigs pa ma yin na //
translated: It is illogical that that which has already been obtained is a cause for obtaining itself.

original: mdo sde dang gnyi ga yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa la dbang po dang don gnyis nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo sde dang gnyi ga yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa la dbang po dang don gnyis nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and both are contradicted by the sutras.üîΩThe sutras are contradicted because the two, the sense faculty and object, are not capable of producing consciousness that has already arisen or that has not yet arisen.

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sutras are contradicted because it is said, ‚ÄúConsciousness arises in dependence on the two.‚Äù

original: de ltar na re zhig rnam pa gcig mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rnam pa gcig mdo sde dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in the first place, the two are contradicted by the sutras.

original: gcig la gcig rgyu nyid yin na yang gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal ba rnam pa gnyis pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gcig la gcig rgyu nyid yin na yang gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde dang 'gal ba rnam pa gnyis pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: If the two are the cause of consciousness, the sutra is contradicted that says, ‚ÄúConsciousness arises in dependence on the two.‚Äù This is the second way the two are contradicted by the sutras.

translated: The cause of the desire neither to be separated from it nor not to be separated from it is the cause of the feeling that is neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: zhes bya ba ni bral bar mi 'dod ba'i rgyu ni bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bral bar mi 'dod ba'i rgyu ni bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cause of the desire not to be separated from it is the pleasant feeling.

original: bral bar 'dod pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal lo //üîΩgnyi ga ma yin pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bral bar 'dod pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal lo // gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: The cause of the desire to be separated from it is the unpleasant feeling.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of the desire neither to be separated from it nor not to be separated from it is the feeling that is neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: 'o na ci las she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci las she na /
translated: From what is it a cause?

original: de'i bde ba ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa nyid du mthong nas de sun 'byin pa las so zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod par mthong ba ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa nyid yin par de'i 'dod
analyzed: de'i bde ba ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa nyid du mthong nas de sun 'byin pa las so zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod par mthong ba ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa nyid yin par de'i 'dod
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúone sees it as an obstruction to moral discipline and meditative stabilization‚Äù is that one sees it as incompatible with moral discipline and meditative stabilization.

original: chags las skyes pa'i bde ba la mthong zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chags las skyes pa'i bde ba la mthong zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúone sees pleasure arising from attachment‚Äù is that one sees pleasure arising from attachment to the pleasure of the first two meditative stabilizations.

original: de sun 'byin pa las so zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba sun 'byin pa las bral bar 'dod ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de sun 'byin pa las so zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba sun 'byin pa las bral bar 'dod ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúone abandons it‚Äù is that one abandons the feeling of pleasure and one generates the desire to be free from it.

original: de yang tshor ba gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal med pas na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang bde ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: de yang tshor ba gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal med pas na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dang bde ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúSince the other two feelings do not intrinsically have the nature of suffering,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshor ba 'di gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba med pas na dgongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba 'di gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba med pas na dgongs pa can gyi sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: Since these two feelings are not suffering by their intrinsic reality, they are taught to be suffering in the sense of an underlying base.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is taught to be suffering in the sense of the suffering of the formations due to impermanence.

original: bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi sdug bsngal yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi sdug bsngal yin par bstan to //
translated: The pleasant feeling is taught to be suffering in the sense of the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal ni ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal yin no //üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin /üîΩbde ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin par bstan to zhes smras pa gang yin pa dag ji ltar 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal @165a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal yin no // sdug bsngal yang ma yin / bde ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin par bstan to zhes smras pa gang yin pa dag ji ltar 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sdug bsngal @165a * //
translated: The unpleasant feeling is suffering by its intrinsic reality.üîΩThe feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is taught to be suffering in the sense of the suffering of the formations due to impermanence.

original: ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant suffering in the sense of the suffering of the formations due to impermanence?

original: 'phags pa rnams la mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is disagreeable to the ƒÅryas.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'phags ba rnams la mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'phags ba rnams la mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: All contaminated things are disagreeable to the aryas because of the impermanence of conditioned states.

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis de yang 'phags pa rnams la mngon sum kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis de yang 'phags pa rnams la mngon sum kho na yin gyi /
translated: The suffering of conditioned states is directly perceived by the aryas,

original: byis pa rnams la ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ma yin no //
translated: but not by ordinary beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lag mthil spu nyag gcig gzhag pa //
analyzed: lag mthil spu nyag gcig gzhag pa //
translated: A single hair placed in the palm

original: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
translated: is not felt by the person,

original: mig tu song na de nyid kyis //
analyzed: mig tu song na de nyid kyis //
translated: but if it enters the eye,

original: nyam nga ba dang gnod skyed bzhin //
analyzed: nyam nga ba dang gnod skyed bzhin //
translated: it causes distress and harm.

original: byis pa rnams ni lag mthil 'dra //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni lag mthil 'dra //
translated: Ordinary beings are like the palm

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
translated: that does not feel the hair of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni mig dang 'dra //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni mig dang 'dra //
translated: The aryas are like the eye

original: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: that is greatly distressed by it.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su 'gyur ba nyid gsungs kyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su 'gyur ba nyid gsungs kyi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Why did the Bhagavan state the truth of suffering as ‚Äúthe truth of change‚Äù?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum bstan pa yin la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de la sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
translated: Here, suffering is the suffering of suffering.

original: bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin no ;üîΩ/ sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin no ; / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Pleasure is the suffering of change.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
translated: Neither pleasure nor suffering is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la bya ste /
analyzed: de khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal la bya ste /
translated: Because it is all-pervading, it is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de ni tshor ba thams cad la khyab pas so //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba thams cad la khyab pas so //
translated: This is because it pervades all feelings.üîΩIt is not so, because it is stated with reference to the five aggregates that are the basis of clinging.

original: mi 'gyur te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar lam la thal bar 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar lam la thal bar 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not so that the path is subject to the same consequence, because it is stated with reference to the five aggregates that are the basis of clinging.

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dgongs nas gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes de skad gsungs so //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba yin par bstan na go //üîΩlam yang mi rtag pa yin na 'dir ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po gang yin pa de kho na mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dgongs nas gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes de skad gsungs so // ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba yin par bstan na go // lam yang mi rtag pa yin na 'dir ci'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po gang yin pa de kho na mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, intending the five appropriated aggregates, he said, ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.‚ÄùüîΩWhy is that?üîΩIf it is taught that whatever is impermanent is suffering, then why is the path not included among the appropriated aggregates?

original: lam ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Why is it that only those appropriated aggregates are suffering because they are impermanent?

original: de'i phyir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po gang yin pa de nyid la zhes rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po gang yin pa de nyid la zhes rgyas par smras te /
translated: Therefore, he said, ‚ÄúWhatever is the basis of aspiration and attachment . . . ‚Äù

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa ni 'dun pa @165b dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa ni 'dun pa @165b dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The object of aspiration and attachment is the basis of aspiration and attachment.

original: de la 'dun pa ni thob par 'gyur ba'i yul la 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni thob par 'gyur ba'i yul la 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire for an object that has not yet been obtained.

original: 'dod chags ni thob zin pa'i yul la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni thob zin pa'i yul la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the strong desire for an object that has already been obtained.

original: de nyid la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis ni mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba ni de la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po de la skyon du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis ni mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba ni de la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po de la skyon du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea of impermanence in that very thing brings about the idea of its being disagreeable. This is because one sees the faults in the thing that one desires and is attached to.

original: tshol ba dang chags pa yang de la skyon du mthong na mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshol ba dang chags pa yang de la skyon du mthong na mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If one sees the faults in the search for and attachment to that thing, then the idea of its being disagreeable is brought about.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: mi mthun pa sdug bsngal ba de la dgongs nas gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bstan to zhes bya ba de la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po ni mi mthun pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi mthun pa sdug bsngal ba de la dgongs nas gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bstan to zhes bya ba de la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dngos po ni mi mthun pa yin gyi /
translated: With that disagreeable suffering in mind, it is taught: ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.‚Äù The thing that one desires and is attached to is disagreeable.

original: lam ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyi dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: lam ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyi dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But the path is not the thing that one desires and is attached to.

original: de'i 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the object of one‚Äôs desire and attachment.

original: de gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to that.

original: de tshol ba ni dge ba'i chos 'dun pa yin la gus pa gces su byed pa ni 'dod chags ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshol ba ni dge ba'i chos 'dun pa yin la gus pa gces su byed pa ni 'dod chags ma yin no //
translated: The search for that is the will for virtue, and the respect for it is not passion.

original: de bas na der ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na der ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'dren par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the idea of impermanence does not lead to the idea of something unpleasant in that case,

original: mi mthun pa ni sdug bsngal yin pas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni sdug bsngal yin pas so //
translated: because the unpleasant is suffering.

original: de bas na lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ma lus par gtan du sdug bsngal las nges par 'byin pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ma lus par gtan du sdug bsngal las nges par 'byin pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no problem with the path, because it is the means of definitely leading out of suffering without remainder and forever.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang /üîΩdngos po gang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la dngos po gang dga' ba'i yul zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus kyang / dngos po gang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la dngos po gang dga' ba'i yul zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The noble Sariputra also said:üîΩWhatever things are the objects of pleasure,üîΩthe objects of pleasure are the objects of attachment.

original: dga' ba ni 'dir 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid bde ba yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: dga' ba ni 'dir 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid bde ba yin par dgongs so //
translated: The pleasure is the mental satisfaction associated with passion.

original: de mi rtag pa nyid du mthong na mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skyon med par mthong na ni de la rjes su mthun pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhing dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de mi rtag pa nyid du mthong na mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skyon med par mthong na ni de la rjes su mthun pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhing dga' ba yin no //
translated: If one sees it as faultless, then one has the perception of it as agreeable and one delights in it.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa skyon du mthong na mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa yin no //üîΩbdag gi dga' ba ni de phra rgyas su gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni dngos po der ro //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa skyon du mthong na mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa yin no // bdag gi dga' ba ni de phra rgyas su gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni dngos po der ro //
translated: Therefore, if one sees impermanence as a fault, it becomes the perception of it as disagreeable.üîΩOne does not delight in that, i.e., one does not delight in that object as a latent tendency.

original: phra rgyas su zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags phra rgyas su dmigs shing phra rgyas su dga' ba la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //üîΩde ltar na lam ni dga' ba'i yul ma yin pas de la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'brel par byed @166a * //
analyzed: phra rgyas su zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags phra rgyas su dmigs shing phra rgyas su dga' ba la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya'o // de ltar na lam ni dga' ba'i yul ma yin pas de la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis mi mthun pa'i 'du shes 'brel par byed @166a * //
translated: One does not delight in that object as a latent tendency, i.e., one does not delight in that object as a latent tendency of attachment.üîΩThus, since the path is not an object of delight, the perception of impermanence does not create a perception of it as disagreeable.

original: pa ma yin bas lam la thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin bas lam la thal bar 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consequence that the path would be disagreeable does not hold.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis for the experience of pain, etc.‚Äù is an elaboration on the term ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: dngos po gang yin pa ni zhes bya ba ni nye bar lan pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩsdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba gnas su gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po gang yin pa ni zhes bya ba ni nye bar lan pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do // sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba gnas su gyur pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: The term ‚Äúentity‚Äù refers to the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis for the experience of pain, etc.‚Äù means the basis for the experience of the feeling of pain, the basis for the experience of the feeling of pleasure, and the basis for the experience of the feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are associated with both origination and destruction.

original: rim bzhin du mi mthun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa ni skye ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: rim bzhin du mi mthun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa ni skye ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the appropriate order‚Äù means that the basis for the experience of the feeling of pain is not agreeable because it is associated with origination.

original: 'di ltar de ni skya ba nyid ni gnod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni skya ba nyid ni gnod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because origination is accompanied by harm.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni skye ba sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni skye ba sdug bsngal ba /
translated: The Lord has said that the feeling of pain is painful when it arises,

original: gnas pa sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: gnas pa sdug bsngal ba /
translated: painful when it abides,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and painful when it changes.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the things that are the basis of the feeling of pain.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa ni 'bral ba dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba'i gnas su gyur pa ni 'bral ba dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: The basis of the feeling of pleasure is disagreeable because it is connected with separation and loss.

original: de ni rnam par 'jig pa gnod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par 'jig pa gnod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a change that is accompanied by harm.

original: ji skad mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: ji skad mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: As it is said in another sutra:

original: bde ba'i tshor ba skye ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba skye ba bde ba'o //
translated: The arising of the feeling of pleasure is pleasant.

original: gnas pa bde ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa bde ba'o //
translated: Its abiding is pleasant.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ba'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu'i tshor ba la bde ba yin par rtogs te /

original: dper na chu shin tu dron pos gdungs pa na chu cung zad dro ba la grang ba zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu shin tu dron pos gdungs pa na chu cung zad dro ba la grang ba zhes bya ba bzhin no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po'i tshor bas gzir ba las tshor ba bar ma la sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par rtogs so //
translated: He understands that a feeling which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant arises from a feeling of great suffering.

original: dper na dpyid kyi nyi tshan gyis yongs su gdungs pas sngar dgun gyi nyi ma la dro ba yang ma yin grang ba ma yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dpyid kyi nyi tshan gyis yongs su gdungs pas sngar dgun gyi nyi ma la dro ba yang ma yin grang ba ma yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po'i tshor ba sdug bsngal yin par rtogs so //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang ci yin zhes rgya par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is the characteristic of a feeling of suffering?

analyzed: gang skyes na mi 'bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bus nye bar mtshan ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The answer is: that from which one wishes to be separated when it arises. This is from the point of view of the result which is characterized by the effect.

original: de sdug bsngal du ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin par rtogs pa yod pas so //

translated: How can that be established as suffering? Because it is understood to be the result which is contrary to the feeling of suffering.

original: 'on te chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po tha dad pa'i @167a * //
analyzed: 'on te chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po tha dad pa'i @167a * //
translated: Or is it different in terms of small, medium, and great?

original: phyir 'bras bu 'di tha dad pa yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: phyir 'bras bu 'di tha dad pa yin no zhes smra na /
translated: Or do you say that the effect is different because the cause is different, i.e., because the cause is weak, middling, strong?

original: 'o na ni gang skyes na bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba zhes bya bar tshor ba 'di thams cad sdug bsngal yin par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te gang la brten na gnod par 'gyur ba de zhes bya ba ni byed pas nye bar mtshan pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //

translated: If that is so, then this feeling, which is called ‚Äúthat which arises when one desires to be separated from it,‚Äù would not be suffering.üîΩIf you say that it is suffering because it is characterized by harm, then that which is characterized by benefit would not be suffering.

original: gang la brten na phan par 'gyur ba de ji ltar sdug bsngal yin par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dang mi mthun par byed pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yod pas so //
analyzed: gang la brten na phan par 'gyur ba de ji ltar sdug bsngal yin par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dang mi mthun par byed pa'i nye bar mtshon pa yod pas so //
translated: And how could that which is characterized by benefit be suffering?üîΩIf you say that it is suffering because it is characterized by what is contrary to it, then that which is characterized by what is not contrary to it would not be suffering.üîΩAnd how could that which is characterized by what is not contrary to it be suffering?

original: 'on te ji ltar 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: How does the noble one see it as suffering?

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid kyis tshor ba rnams 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs so zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshor ba thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid yin par bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid kyis tshor ba rnams 'phags pas sdug bsngal bar gzigs so zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshor ba thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid yin par bstan gyi /
translated: If you say that the noble ones see feelings as suffering because of the suffering of conditioned states, this shows that the general characteristic of all feelings is the characteristic of suffering.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: But it does not show that the specific characteristic of feelings is suffering.

original: de bas na tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'di la tha dad pa yod du zin kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'di la tha dad pa yod du zin kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, even if there were a difference in the specific characteristics of feelings, it would not be established.

original: de yang tha dad pa med pa yin pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de yang mi rtag pa nyid du mthun pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa med pa yin pas 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de yang mi rtag pa nyid du mthun pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that difference would not exist, and the suffering of conditioned states is of the same nature as impermanence.

original: ji ltar de'i sgo nas tshor ba la sdug bsngal chung ba nyid dang / bar ma dang / chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgo nas tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni 'du byed mi rtag pa de'i sgo nas kha cig tu ni chung du yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i sgo nas tshor ba la sdug bsngal chung ba nyid dang / bar ma dang / chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgo nas tha dad pa med pa nyid yin na ni 'du byed mi rtag pa de'i sgo nas kha cig tu ni chung du yin no //
translated: If there is no difference through the impermanence of formations, then it is not possible to say that through the impermanence of formations, in some cases it is lesser,

original: kha cig tu ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'bring yin no //
translated: in some cases it is middling,

original: kha cig tu ni chen po yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni chen po yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po tha dad par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de la ni chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po tha dad par rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that the lesser, middling, and greater are different in that which is the intrinsic identity of suffering,

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rkyen tha dad pas tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different through the difference of the conditions of intrinsic identity.

original: gal te yang 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid kho nas tshor ba zhes bya ba nyid yin na ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la sdug bsngal gsum zhes bya ba'i mdo sde yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te yang 'du byed sdug bsngal nyid kho nas tshor ba zhes bya ba nyid yin na ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la sdug bsngal gsum zhes bya ba'i mdo sde yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If feeling were only the truth of suffering of formations, then the sutra statement, ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of suffering‚Äù would not exist, because there would be no two kinds of suffering, i.e., the suffering of change and the suffering of suffering.

original: 'on te chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po so so tha dad par myong ba de dag sdug bsngal yin no zhes ji ltar srid par smra ba de la 'di brjod par bya ba ste /

translated: If you say that the three kinds of feeling are suffering because they are experienced as weak, medium, and strong, then this should be said to the one who advocates that position:

analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal ba 'di gang @167b yin /

analyzed: gang sdug bsngal chen po yin no zhes brjod do //

analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang /

original: gang yin par ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gang yin par ma yin no zhe'o //

original: gal te de dag 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de dag 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid yin na ni /

analyzed: gal te chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po tha dad pa yin no zhe na ni ming gzhan du brjod pa yin te /

analyzed: sdug bsngal la chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po'i bye brag nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: If you say that the suffering of suffering is one thing,

analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal yang gzhan /

analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i dngos po ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba sdug bsngal yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa na sdug bsngal chung ba'i tshor ba yod par 'grub par 'gyur te /

original: bde ba'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang bas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med cing rnam par dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang bas sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med cing rnam par dpyod pa med pa /
translated: The first absorption is said to possess joy and pleasure born of seclusion because it is said,üîΩThe second absorption is said to possess joy and pleasure born of concentration because it is said,üîΩThe third absorption is said to possess pleasure because it is said,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / btang snyoms can dran pa dang ldan pa bde @168a * //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / btang snyoms can dran pa dang ldan pa bde @168a * //
translated: The third absorption is said to possess pleasure because it is said,üîΩThe fourth absorption is said to possess equanimity because it is said,

original: bal gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bal gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth absorption is said to possess equanimity because it is said,

original: de'i gong mar bar ma sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs nas yid bde ba dang
analyzed: de'i gong mar bar ma sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs nas yid bde ba dang
translated: The feeling of equanimity is taught above that because it is a neutral feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: / yid mi bde ba snga nas med pas yid mi bde ba la sogs pa spangs par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yid mi bde ba snga nas med pas yid mi bde ba la sogs pa spangs par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the fourth absorption to the summit of existence, the Abhidharmakosa states, Having abandoned pleasure and abandoned pain, and also having previously abandoned mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction, he is born there having abandoned pleasure and pain.üîΩHow could the feeling of pain exist in the extremely peaceful meditative attainment?

original: ji ltar shin tu zhi ba'i snyoms par zhugs pa la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba lhag par yod par 'thad ces bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'og ma'i rdzas las gong ma pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas shin tu zhi ba yin te /üîΩde'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba lhag par yod par 'thad /
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu zhi ba'i snyoms par zhugs pa la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba lhag par yod par 'thad ces bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'og ma'i rdzas las gong ma pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas shin tu zhi ba yin te / de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro // de la ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba lhag par yod par 'thad /
translated: The substance of meditative attainment of lower level is more peaceful than the substance of meditative attainment of higher level because it is the antidote of higher level.üîΩHow could the feeling of pain exist in that?

original: bar ma ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bar ma ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: The feeling of equanimity is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las gong na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las gong na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.üîΩBut the Blessed One has said that the perception of pain as pleasure is a perversion.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal bde bar 'du shes pa gang yin pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes gsungs pa yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o snyam pa'i 'du shes ni bde bar 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal bde bar 'du shes pa gang yin pa ni phyin ci log yin no zhes gsungs pa yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o snyam pa'i 'du shes ni bde bar 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The perception of pleasure is the perception of pleasure.

original: bde bar phyin ci log pa yang log par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar phyin ci log pa yang log par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The perversion of pleasure is the grasping of what is painful as pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The perception of pleasure in the two kinds of pain is a perversion.

original: sdug bsngal gnyis ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyis ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The two kinds of pain are the pain of change and the pain of the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal de la sdug bsngal nyid du yongs su mi shes nas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gnyis po de sdug bsngal yin pa yongs su mi shes nas gcig kho nar bde bar 'du shes pa ni phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de la sdug bsngal nyid du yongs su mi shes nas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gnyis po de sdug bsngal yin pa yongs su mi shes nas gcig kho nar bde bar 'du shes pa ni phyin ci log yin no //
translated: one is mistaken in perceiving only pleasure, not fully understanding that the two kinds of suffering are suffering.üîΩIn order to apply oneself to seeing the two kinds of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal nyid gnyis yin par mthong ba la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid mthong bar bya ba dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid mthong bar bya ba la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gnyis yin par mthong ba la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid mthong bar bya ba dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid mthong bar bya ba la sbyor bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to apply oneself to seeing the suffering of change and the suffering of the formative forces.üîΩBecause it is the means of becoming free from attachment to that,

original: de la chags pa dang bral ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de la sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis yod par mthong ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa de gnyis kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa mthong ba ni de la phyir phyogs par mi
analyzed: de la chags pa dang bral ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni de la sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis yod par mthong ba ni sdug bsngal rnam pa de gnyis kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa mthong ba ni de la phyir phyogs par mi
translated: because it is the means of becoming free from attachment to that, to the two kinds of suffering, when one sees the two kinds of suffering, one sees the aspects of the intrinsic nature of those two kinds of suffering.

original: 'gyur ro // sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by this?

original: bde ba'i @168b tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i @168b tshor ba ni sdug bsngal nyid yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that pleasant feeling should be regarded as suffering.

original: sran ma sha'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sran ma sha'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a heap of beans,

original: dper na sran ma sha'i nang na sran mud ga la sogs pa med pa ma yin yang sran ma sha mang ba'i phyir ma sha'i phung po zhes bya ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sran ma sha'i nang na sran mud ga la sogs pa med pa ma yin yang sran ma sha mang ba'i phyir ma sha'i phung po zhes bya ba de bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, a heap of beans is not without mung beans, etc., but because of the abundance of beans, it is called a heap of beans.

original: btsun pa gzhon nu len gyis ni bde ba khas blangs nas ji ltar de la sdug bsngal gyi blo 'byung ba smra bar byed do //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: btsun pa gzhon nu len gyis ni bde ba khas blangs nas ji ltar de la sdug bsngal gyi blo 'byung ba smra bar byed do // sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Venerable KumƒÅralƒÅta, having accepted the existence of pleasure, explains how the idea of suffering can arise in regard to it.üîΩBecause it is the cause of suffering, etc.üîΩBecause it is the cause of suffering,üîΩfor pleasure is the origin of the suffering of change,

original: 'di ltar bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba'am /
translated: or the origin of the suffering of pain.

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'i rim gyis 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba ni yang srid kyi rgyur 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'i rim gyis 'di ltar bde ba'i tshor ba ni yang srid kyi rgyur 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: craving, grasping, and becoming, in this way the cause of renewed existence is pleasure.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal mang pos bskyed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bde ba ni zhing rmo ba dang / tshong bya ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi nyung bas bskyed cing 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang pos bskyed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bde ba ni zhing rmo ba dang / tshong bya ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi nyung bas bskyed cing 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because it is produced by many sufferings. Pleasure is produced and arises from many sufferings, such as the suffering of plowing, trading, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal yin pa la de yid du 'ong ba yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / lus kyi nad dang / ngal ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba sdug bsngal ba yin yang de la 'dod pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa la de yid du 'ong ba yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / lus kyi nad dang / ngal ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba sdug bsngal ba yin yang de la 'dod pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though it is suffering, it is pleasant. Even though the varieties of suffering such as hunger, thirst, physical illness, and fatigue exist, desire arises in regard to them.

original: gtan tshigs de dag kun gyi phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de dag kun gyi phyir /
translated: For all these reasons,

original: sdug bsngal yin na bde bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin na bde bar 'dzin to //
translated: when it is suffering, it is grasped as pleasure.

original: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la grags pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan la grags pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught by way of what is renowned to others.

original: de dag ni bde ba yang yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: de dag ni bde ba yang yod pa ma yin /
translated: They do not have pleasure,

original: bde ba'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: nor do they have a cause of pleasure.

original: 'di ltar btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / bgo ba la sogs pa de dag bde ba'i rgyur brtags pa de dag ni bde ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / bgo ba la sogs pa de dag bde ba'i rgyur brtags pa de dag ni bde ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, those things that are imagined to be the cause of pleasure, such as drink, food, clothing, etc., are not the cause of pleasure.üîΩThe idea is that the pacification of other suffering is pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba bde ba yin par sems te zhes bya ba ni bde ba med du zin kyang bde ba'i blo 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan zhi ba bde ba yin par sems te zhes bya ba ni bde ba med du zin kyang bde ba'i blo 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that even though pleasure does not exist, the idea of pleasure is established.

original: de la re zhig 'di dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'di dri bar bya ste /
translated: In this regard, first this should be asked:

original: ci btung ba dang / bza' ba la sogs pa de dag bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: ci btung ba dang / bza' ba la sogs pa de dag bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: Are those things, such as drink, food, etc., the cause of the pacification of the suffering of hunger, thirst, cold, heat, etc.?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin /
translated: Or are they the cause of suffering?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu yin na ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu yin na ni ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If it is the cause of the cessation of suffering, how can it be established as the cause of suffering?

original: 'di la yang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni yod pa ma yin pa de kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni yod pa ma yin pa de kho na yin te /
translated: Here, the feeling of suffering does not exist at all,üîΩbecause the cause of suffering is not present.

original: @169a * // sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de kho na bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: @169a * // sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de kho na bzhin du gnas so //
translated: The same point is made here.

original: btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag shin tu mang ba dang / dus ma yin par bsten na sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag nyid tshod zin pa dang / dus su bsten na sdug bsngal zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / gos la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag shin tu mang ba dang / dus ma yin par bsten na sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag nyid tshod zin pa dang / dus su bsten na sdug bsngal zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one drinks, eats, wears clothing, etc., to excess or at the wrong time, suffering arises. When one drinks, eats, wears clothing, etc., in moderation and at the proper time, suffering ceases.

original: rgyu gang kho nas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba de kho nas sdug bsngal zhi bar 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang kho nas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba de kho nas sdug bsngal zhi bar 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that the very cause of suffering is also the cause of the cessation of suffering.

original: 'on te bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams bsten na ji ltar bde ba'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba rnams kyis sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams bsten na ji ltar bde ba'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: But if those tormented by the suffering of hunger, thirst, cold, heat, and so on, rely on the causes of suffering, how could they have the idea of pleasure?

original: 'on te sdug bsngal gzhan la /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal gzhan la /
translated: If you are conceited about what is actually suffering, thinking ‚ÄúI am happy,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed na ni btung ba dang bza' ba la sogs pa'i dus las dus gzhan gyi tshe na yang shin tu bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed na ni btung ba dang bza' ba la sogs pa'i dus las dus gzhan gyi tshe na yang shin tu bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: then you will be conceited about what is actually very pleasant, even when it is not the time for drinking, eating, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause of suffering.

original: gang dag sdug bsngal gzhan la bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de ni de med na shin tu bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag sdug bsngal gzhan la bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de ni de med na shin tu bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you are conceited about what is actually suffering, thinking ‚ÄúI am happy,‚Äù then when that is absent, you will be conceited about what is actually very pleasant.

original: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cause of pleasure is not non-existent‚Äù indicates that the reason is not established.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: gal te sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba kho na la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba kho na la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba yin na ni /
translated: if the idea of pleasure arose only in the pacification of pain,

original: ngal ba'i lus sku mnye byed pa dang / spyod lam gzhan byed pa gnyis bde ba nyid la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: ngal ba'i lus sku mnye byed pa dang / spyod lam gzhan byed pa gnyis bde ba nyid la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba ma yin na /
translated: then the idea of pleasure would not arise in the pleasure of massaging a tired body or in the pleasure of changing one‚Äôs posture.

original: dus ring pos zhes bya ba ni sku mnye byed pa'i dus las ring du len pa dang / spyod lam gzhan byed pa las yun ring du lon te /
analyzed: dus ring pos zhes bya ba ni sku mnye byed pa'i dus las ring du len pa dang / spyod lam gzhan byed pa las yun ring du lon te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúafter a long time‚Äù refers to the time after massaging a tired body or the time after changing one‚Äôs posture.

original: ngal ba zhi ba de 'dra ba kho na'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na yang sdug bsngal zhi ba yod pas so //
analyzed: ngal ba zhi ba de 'dra ba kho na'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na yang sdug bsngal zhi ba yod pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe idea of pleasure arises‚Äù means that the idea of the pacification of pain arises.

original: lan 'ga' yang bde ba la yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur zhes rgyas par 'byung ba des ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba yod mod kyi /
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang bde ba la yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur zhes rgyas par 'byung ba des ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba yod mod kyi /
translated: It is not the case that there is no awareness of pleasure at all, for the S≈´tra Elaborating the Meanings says that the awareness of pleasure arises from the mere pacification of pain.

original: 'on kyang bde ba nye bar brtags pa tsam yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba nye bar brtags pa tsam yin par ston to //
translated: However, this is merely a designation of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i blo yang ma yin te tshor ba gzhan bde ba'i tshor ba gzhan la yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i blo yang ma yin te tshor ba gzhan bde ba'i tshor ba gzhan la yongs su mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not pleasure, because it does not definitely determine another feeling that is pleasure.

original: 'dir ni sdug bsngal nye @169b bar zhi ba la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba ma yin pa de lta bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni sdug bsngal nye @169b bar zhi ba la bde ba'i blo 'byung ba ma yin pa de lta bu kho na yin te /
translated: In this context, the awareness of pleasure does not arise from the mere pacification of pain.

original: de lta ma yin na gang phal cher bza' ba dang btung ba 'bad de zhim po tshol bar byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang phal cher bza' ba dang btung ba 'bad de zhim po tshol bar byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, why would most people seek to eat and drink delicious food and drink?

original: 'bras chan phal ba dang 'bras kul ma sa dang rtsa ba mo dang chu tsam gyis kyang bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras chan phal ba dang 'bras kul ma sa dang rtsa ba mo dang chu tsam gyis kyang bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Undoubtedly, the mere pacification of the suffering of hunger and thirst is achieved by eating ordinary rice and vegetables, or by eating roots and drinking water.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba zhim po la longs spyod pa'i tshe ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba zhim po la longs spyod pa'i tshe ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin no //
translated: When one experiences delicious food and drink, it is a pleasant feeling.üîΩWhen one is free from hunger and thirst, etc.,

original: gang gi tshe bkres pa dang / skom pa dang bral nas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba des kyang sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam la bde ba yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byang par ston to //

translated: a delicious tangible object, or a delicious phenomenon.üîΩDelicious taste, etc., are distinguished as being very delicious or extremely delicious.üîΩDelicious smell is distinguished as being very delicious or extremely delicious.

analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan nye bar zhi ba 'ba' zhig la ma yin par ni lung mdo sde 'di nyid las kyang tshor ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: tshor ba gsum ste zhas rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //

analyzed: rigs pas kyang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu rnam par gnas pa la sogs pa'i rigs pas tshor ba gsum grub pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dir yang rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis //

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /

analyzed: de thams cad kyi 'byung gnas phung po yin no zhes bya ba la phung po ni gnas dang bcas pa'i skye mched drug go //

original: ji skad du mdo sde las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde las /

analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad reg pa la brten nas yin no zhes gsungs so //

original: reg pa gtso bo'i rkyen yin par yang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa tha dad pa las /

translated: Contact that is the experience of pleasure sukhavedya, contact that is the experience of pain du·∏•khavedya and contact that is the experience of neither pleasure nor pain adu·∏•khƒÅsukhavedya are distinct.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /

analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: in this way means because.üîΩWhen that feeling arises,üîΩwhen feeling arises, other conditions, i.e., the causal condition, the immediately antecedent condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition, and also intention, conceptualization, etc.
