translated: The word etc. includes the aggregates of arising, enduring, and decaying. Contact is dependent on them. When feeling arises by the power of the object, contact is definitely not dependent on them.

original: tshor ba'i bsdus pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa yang 'dir rnam pa lngar bstan te /üîΩrab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du tshor ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bsdus pa'i don rnam par gzhag pa yang 'dir rnam pa lngar bstan te / rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du tshor ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of feeling is presented here in five topics:üîΩThe presentation of the classification of feeling is taught in detail in the lines beginning: ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of feeling.‚Äù

analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /

analyzed: gang skyes na mi 'bral bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'o zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen this arises, the wish to not be separated from it arises.‚ÄùüîΩThe presentation of the three kinds of feeling is taught in detail in the lines beginning:

analyzed: tshor ba gsum par gzhag pa ni ji @170b skad du der yang tshor ba gnyis la ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba med pas na zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSince the other two feelings do not have the nature of suffering.‚Äù

analyzed: rnam par nges par rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The presentation of the ascertainment of feeling is taught in detail in the lines beginning:

analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshor ba gsum bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúSome say that the teaching of three kinds of feeling is provisional.üîΩSuffering is only one kind of feeling.‚Äù

analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid ni tshor ba gcig kho na yin no zhe na zhes rgyas par bstan pa'i gtso bo'i rkyen rnam par gzhag pa ni ji skad du /

analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i reg pa tha dad pas zhes rgyas par bstan pa'o //

original: tshor ba rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The analysis of feeling.üîΩWhat is craving? Craving is threefold, due to the distinction of the three feelings.

original: srid pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes gsungs na de yang gnas tha dad pas ni rnam pa drug / khams tha dad pas ni rnam pa gsum /

original: dmigs pa tha dad pas ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pas ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is fourfold, due to the distinction of the four sustenances.üîΩIt is threefold, due to the distinction of the three realms.

analyzed: bdag gis dngos po dang yul gnyis kyis thob pa dang / ma thob pa gnyis las so zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: It is twofold, due to the distinction of the two kinds of acquisition, i.e., acquisition of what has not been acquired and acquisition of what has been acquired.

analyzed: de bas na dmigs mi phyed na tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred par 'dir dgongs pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: de dmigs kyis dbye ba'i phyir sred pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba zhes smras so //

translated: In accordance with the distinctions of those to be trained, it is as previously explained means that in accordance with the distinctions of those to be trained who are present at the time, it is as previously explained.

analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig tu ni rnam par dbye ba yang ma gsungs so zhes bstan pa'o //

original: khyi'i sbrang bu bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyi la sbrang bu rgyu ba la khyi'i sbrang bu zhes ston to /
analyzed: khyi'i sbrang bu bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyi la sbrang bu rgyu ba la khyi'i sbrang bu zhes ston to /
translated: Like a dog's fly means that just as a fly that moves around on a dog is called a dog's fly.

original: tshig bar ma mi mngon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig bar ma mi mngon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: grong gi phag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grong na rgyu ba'i phag pa la grong gi phag pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: grong gi phag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grong na rgyu ba'i phag pa la grong gi phag pa zhes brjod de /

original: tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig bar ma mi mngon par byas pa de bzhin no //

original: ci rigs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci rigs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sred pa ni gzugs kyi sred pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sred pa ni gzugs kyi sred pa ste /
translated: Craving in the realm of form is craving for form.

analyzed: tshig bar ma mi mngon pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The middle term is elided, as before.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, craving in the formless realm should be connected.

original: de dag nyid khams gsum pa'i sred pa yin par @171a * //
analyzed: de dag nyid khams gsum pa'i sred pa yin par @171a * //
translated: It is taught that these are the cravings of the three realms.

original: bstan to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du spyod pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas nas bstan to //
analyzed: bstan to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du spyod pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas nas bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúrealm‚Äù is elided, as before.

analyzed: go rims bzhin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: In order, those who are not free from desire for the desire realm have craving in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who are not free from desire for the form realm have craving in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For those not free from attachment to the formless realm, it is called ‚Äúin the formless realm.‚Äù

original: sa gang yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang sa de nyid kyi sred pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i tshor ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sa gang yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang sa de nyid kyi sred pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i tshor ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The feeling of a certain level is the condition of craving for that level. The feeling of the first absorption is the condition of craving for the level of the first absorption.

original: rgyas par srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sa'i tshor ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sa'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sa'i tshor ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi sa'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no //

translated: Pleasant feeling is the condition of craving to possess it and not be separated from it. Pleasant feeling is the condition of craving to possess it and craving not to be separated from it.

analyzed: sdug bsngal ni de dang mi ldan zhing 'bral bar sred pa'i rkyen yin no //

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs de la mngon par dga'
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de'i gnas skabs de la mngon par dga'
translated: The state of that feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is the state of that feeling.

original: ba ni de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'o //üîΩde'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba nyid sred pa yin pas de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa ste /
analyzed: ba ni de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'o // de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba nyid sred pa yin pas de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa ste /
translated: Craving is delight in that state.

original: de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa de'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa de'i rkyen yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi dngos po gang la zhes smras so //

original: lus kyi dngos po gang la zhe na /

original: 'o na de lta na phung po nyid bdag tu smra ba yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni de dag bdag tu smra ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na phung po nyid bdag tu smra ba yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni de dag bdag tu smra ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then the aggregates themselves are the self, because they are the basis of the belief in a self.

original: gang phung po lnga po de dag la bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni de lta na mdo sde las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga las bdag tu smra ba gzhan yin par bstan pa yin gyi phung po nyid ni
analyzed: gang phung po lnga po de dag la bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni de lta na mdo sde las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga las bdag tu smra ba gzhan yin par bstan pa yin gyi phung po nyid ni
translated: If one conceives of the five aggregates as the self, then the sutra teaches that the belief in a self is different from the five appropriated aggregates.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //

translated: If the aggregates are the self because they are the basis of the belief in a self, how can that be correct?üîΩThe expression of the sutra should be analyzed differently.

original: 'dir yang gzhan du yin pas zhes bya ba ni mdo sde der ni tshig sbyar ba gzhan du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan du yin pas zhes bya ba ni mdo sde der ni tshig sbyar ba gzhan du bya ba yin no //

original: ji ltar gzhan du bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du bya zhe na /

original: bdag tu smra ba ni tshig tsam yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba ni tshig tsam yin la /

original: de la mngon par zhen pa ni bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa ni bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phra rgyas ni bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pa'i phra rgyas su 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //

original: 'dir yang gzhan du yin pas zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan du yin pas zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la bdag go zhes smra bas bdag tu smra ba yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The assertion of a self is called the assertion of a self because it is the assertion ‚Äúthis is a self.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul @176b zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa gsungs pa ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul @176b zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba ste /
translated: The four clingings are the clinging to desire, the clinging to assertions, the clinging to rules and ritual, and the clinging to a doctrine of self.

original: de dag la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa 'dod pa nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de nye bar len pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa 'dod pa nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The desire and attachment to those are the four graspings. The desire and attachment to those desires, etc., is the grasping of desire.

original: lta ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa ni lta ba nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa ni lta ba nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The desire and attachment to the assertions is the grasping of assertions.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The craving and passion for morality and ritual is the appropriation of morality and ritual.

original: bdag tu smra ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The craving and passion for the assertion of a self is the appropriation of the assertion of a self.

original: de la ldan par mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan par tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de la ldan par mngon par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan par tshol ba'o //
translated: The desire for possession is craving. The desire for possession of desire, etc. is the search for possession of desire, etc.

original: de dang ldan pa mngon par dga' ba ni de la 'dod chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags ni zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa mngon par dga' ba ni de la 'dod chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags ni zhen pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The delight in that possession is passion. Passion is characterized by attachment.

original: ji ltar na 'dun pa dang 'dod chags nye bar len pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i rnam pa des zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dun pa dang 'dod chags nye bar len pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i rnam pa des zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: How can craving and passion be appropriation? The meaning is: by that form of agent.

original: des 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag len par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags de dag gis te /
analyzed: des 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag len par byed do zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags de dag gis te /
translated: Those desires, etc. are appropriated by that, i.e., by those cravings and passions.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la byed pa por byas nas 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa yin par ston pa ni /üîΩde dag nyid de dag la len pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩ'dun pa dang 'dod chags de dag nyid 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la len par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la byed pa por byas nas 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa yin par ston pa ni / de dag nyid de dag la len pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin te / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags de dag nyid 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la len par byed pa yin te /
translated: and craving and grasping are the appropriated.üîΩThe appropriator is the cause of the five aggregates, and craving and grasping are the appropriated.

original: dngos po grub pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po grub pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The appropriator is the cause of the five aggregates, and craving and grasping are the appropriated.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩThe root text states:

original: de'i phyir de skyes na de'i yid len pa po yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de skyes na de'i yid len pa po yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
translated: When it arises, the mind becomes the appropriator.

original: der 'dun pa dang 'dod chags skyes na yid kyis 'dod pa la sogs pa len par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'dun pa dang 'dod chags skyes na yid kyis 'dod pa la sogs pa len par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When craving and grasping arise, the mind appropriates desire realm objects and so on.üîΩIf craving and grasping are the self and not the five aggregates, then why does the S≈´tra on the Inconceivable Secret of all Buddhas state:

original: gal te bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa 'dun pa dang 'dod chags yin gyi phung po lnga ma yin na mi sdug pa'i mdo sde las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i dbang du byas te gang gsungs pa dge slong dag de la bdag tu smra
analyzed: gal te bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa 'dun pa dang 'dod chags yin gyi phung po lnga ma yin na mi sdug pa'i mdo sde las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i dbang du byas te gang gsungs pa dge slong dag de la bdag tu smra
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: ba nye bar len pa rtag pa dang / ther zug pa dang / gzhan ma dang / yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / yang dag pa de bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa gang yin pa dag khyed kyis nye bar blangs sam zhes gang gsungs pa de dag ji lta bur rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ba nye bar len pa rtag pa dang / ther zug pa dang / gzhan ma dang / yongs su mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang / yang dag pa de bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa gang yin pa dag khyed kyis nye bar blangs sam zhes gang gsungs pa de dag ji lta bur rung bar 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you accept the self that is described by the proponents of a self as permanent, stable, eternal, not subject to change, and existing perfectly and truly?‚Äù

original: @177a * // de la bdag tu smra bas gang la bdag tu btags pa'i dngos po gang blangs ba de dag bdag tu smra pa nye bar len par bstan te zhes bya ba ni las la byed pa por byas nas so //
analyzed: @177a * // de la bdag tu smra bas gang la bdag tu btags pa'i dngos po gang blangs ba de dag bdag tu smra pa nye bar len par bstan te zhes bya ba ni las la byed pa por byas nas so //
translated: The meaning of the passage is as follows: The entities that are designated as the self are taught to be the self that is accepted by the proponents of a self.

original: bdag tu smra bas ci zhig len ce na /
analyzed: bdag tu smra bas ci zhig len ce na /

original: de'i phyir / gang la bdag tu gdags pa'i dngos po zhes smras te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang la bdag tu gdags pa'i dngos po zhes smras te ;
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚Äúthe entities that are designated as the self.‚Äù

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the five appropriated aggregates are accepted.

original: gal te 'dun pa dang 'dod chags dag nye bar len pa yin na ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'i rnam grangs sred pa nyid smras par gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni sred ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'dun pa dang 'dod chags dag nye bar len pa yin na ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'i rnam grangs sred pa nyid smras par gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni sred ba yin la /
translated: If aspiration and attachment are clinging, then is not craving itself stated as the category of clinging that is the condition for clinging?

original: de yang len pa yin pas sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes smras na ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang len pa yin pas sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes smras na ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If craving is stated as the condition for clinging, then craving itself would be stated as the condition for craving.

original: gal te tshor ba la sred pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la sred pa'i rnam grangs kyi rkyen yin par bstan na de la nyes pa ci yod ces bya ba ni tshor ba'i sred pa la brten nas 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang /

translated: If you say that craving for feeling is taught as the condition for craving for desire realm objects and so on, what is wrong with that?

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra bar sred pa skye bas sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra bar sred pa skye bas sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Craving for desire realm objects, craving for views, craving for discipline and ritual, and craving for a doctrine of self arise in dependence on craving for feeling. Therefore craving is taught as the condition for clinging.

original: de ltar ma bstan na yang 'di ji ltar shes par byas pa yin zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni de ltar ma bshad na sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par byas pa yin /üîΩtshor ba la sred pas ni ji ltar rigs par ji ltar srid par khams gsum pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /

translated: If it is not explained in this way, how is this known: ‚ÄúGrasping exists due to the condition of craving?‚ÄùüîΩCraving for feeling is the cause of the three realms of existence, such as the pleasure of feeling and so on, as is appropriate and as is possible.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa dang bral ba dang mi 'bral ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa la sogs pa tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa dang bral ba dang mi 'bral ba la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dod pa la sogs pa tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang /
translated: The reason is that one seeks to possess, be separated from, or not be separated from the feeling of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bdag tu smra ba tshol zhing 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la chags par byed do //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba tshol zhing 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag la chags par byed do //
translated: One seeks desire, view, discipline and austerity, and the self, and one is attached to those desires and so on.

original: gang gis 'dod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog cing rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis 'dod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog cing rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: By what means by the characteristic of imagination and discrimination.

original: gang la 'dod pa gang la chags pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'dod pa gang la chags pa'o //
translated: What means what is desired, what is attached to.

original: don de nyid ces bya ba ni de nyid len pa yin na ni gcig kho nar ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don de nyid ces bya ba ni de nyid len pa yin na ni gcig kho nar ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of that very thing is that if it were grasping, it would not be definite as just one.

original: 'dod pa yul la yin par 'dod pa rnams kyis nye @177b bar len pa gang zhig yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa yul la yin par 'dod pa rnams kyis nye @177b bar len pa gang zhig yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the grasping of those who desire the object of desire?

original: thams cad kyis kyang yang srid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang yang srid do //
translated: All means all sentient beings.

original: len to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: len to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Grasping means grasping rebirth.

original: ji ltar len zhe na /üîΩde tha dad pas yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las rnams srid par 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la len pa tha dad pas yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las rnams de ma thag tu yang srid pa skye ba'i rgyu
analyzed: ji ltar len zhe na / de tha dad pas yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las rnams srid par 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la len pa tha dad pas yang srid par 'gyur ba'i las rnams de ma thag tu yang srid pa skye ba'i rgyu
translated: How is it grasped?

original: nyid du 'gro ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid du 'gro ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the difference in grasping, the actions that lead to rebirth become the cause of rebirth. The meaning is that because of the difference in grasping desire and so on, the actions that lead to rebirth immediately become the cause of rebirth.

original: yang na 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag nyid zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul la 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba de dag nyid tshor ba la sred pa rnams kyis de dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon par zhen pa'i don gyis len pasüîΩna len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa la sogs pa de dag nyid zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul la 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba de dag nyid tshor ba la sred pa rnams kyis de dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon par zhen pa'i tshul gyis bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du mngon par zhen pa'i don gyis len pas na len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called appropriators because they are appropriated by craving for feeling and so on.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du tshig sbyar ba byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdper na sbyin pa'i sbyin pa po yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang sbyin pa de sbyin pa'o zhes ston pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di las zas la sogs pa gang sbyin pa de sbyin pa yin par bstan gyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bzhin du tshig sbyar ba byas pa'i phyir ro // dper na sbyin pa'i sbyin pa po yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang sbyin pa de sbyin pa'o zhes ston pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di las zas la sogs pa gang sbyin pa de sbyin pa yin par bstan gyi /
translated: They are appropriated in the sense that they are the causes of possessing feeling and so on.üîΩThis is similar to the statement in a sutra:üîΩThe giver of giving is a giver.üîΩThis sutra teaches that whatever is given is giving,

original: gang gi sbyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi sbyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not teach that the giver is giving.

original: rab tu byed pa pa dag 'don pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni de dag gi len pa ni gzhan du rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa pa dag 'don pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni de dag gi len pa ni gzhan du rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: The other two are established elsewhere.üîΩThe fetters, bonds, and so on associated with the desire realm

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / phra rgyas dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas bkris pa dang zhes bya ba de la kun du sbyor ba ni rjes su chags pa dang /

translated: The fetters are attachment,üîΩaversion, pride, ignorance, view,

original: khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba rnams te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi dngos po la kun du sbyor ba'i don gyis kun du sbyor ba yin pa'am /

translated: conceit, doubt, envy, and avarice.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor ba'i don gyis yin no ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs la kun du sbyor ba'i don gyis yin no ;
translated: The fetters are so called because they bind one to various sufferings and because they bind one to afflicted entities.

original: / de la rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: / de la rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni 'dod chags te /

analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyong ba ni nga rgyal bdun te /
translated: The fetter of pride is the seven types of pride:üîΩpride,

translated: excessive pride,üîΩthe pride of excessive pride,üîΩthe pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚ÄùüîΩmanifest pride,üîΩsmall pride,

analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che bas kyang che'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / chung ba'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //

analyzed: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o //

analyzed: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba ni gtong ba dang mi mthun pa sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: de bas na lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba bkol te //

analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, false views, and doubt.

original: de la chags pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems las byung ba'i chos ni 'dod chags so //üîΩde zhe 'gras pa'i rnam pa can ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa'i rnam pa can gyi sems las byung ba'i chos ni 'dod chags so // de zhe 'gras pa'i rnam pa can ni khong khro ba'o //

original: khengs pa'i rnam pa can ni nga rgyal lo //üîΩmig mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: khengs pa'i rnam pa can ni nga rgyal lo // mig mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can ni ma rig pa'o //

analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa'i rnam pa can ni lta ba'o //

analyzed: don du mar 'dogs pa'i rnam pa can ni the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt is a mental factor that arises in the form of indecision about the meaning of things.

original: de bas na lta ba'i phra rgyas ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa las gzhan sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa ni nye pa'i nyon mongs pa'o //

original: gang dag phran tshegs dang gzhi las gsungs pa mi dga' ba la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gang dag phran tshegs dang gzhi las gsungs pa mi dga' ba la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: They also include the mental factors such as lack of conscience that are mentioned in the K·π£udraka Collection.

original: kun nas dkris pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The entanglements are eight in number:

analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / rmugs @178b pa dang / gnyid do //

analyzed: de la ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas go rims bzhin du nyes pas ngo tsha med pa'o //

analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna gnyis ni ji ltar sngar smras pa yin no //

analyzed: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o //

original: 'gyod pa ni sems la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni sems la gcags pa'o //

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi dge ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi dge ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: rmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung ba'o //

analyzed: lus 'dzin mi nus shing sems sdud pa ni gnyid do //

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, only the afflicted are entanglements,

analyzed: dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: lta ba nyid nye bar len pa yin pas lta ba nye bar len pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar yang de dag kha cig ni tshul khrims la mchog tu 'dzin cing tshul khrims kyis dag pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gis tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims brtul zhugs nye bar len pa yin par bstan to

analyzed: bdag tu smra ba yang @179a * //
translated: Are they the self-theories and

analyzed: yin la / nye bar len pa yang yin nam /

analyzed: ji ltar gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa de dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa de dag la bdag tu smra ba zhes bya / ci de las gzhan ji skad du smras zin pa la ma gtogs pa gsum pa ming bdag tu smra ba zhes brjod pa zhig yin pa khyed kyis brjod par bya dgos na thams cad kyis kyang 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa yang bdag tu smra ba nye bar
translated: How are they the self-theories and the fetters and so on that are associated with the realms of form and the formless?üîΩYou must explain what you mean by the third alternative, ‚Äúthe self-theories,‚Äù which is not included in the two alternatives you have already stated.

original: len pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it would follow, absurdly, that all of the appropriated aggregates are the self-theories and the appropriated.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: re zhig gal te /
analyzed: re zhig gal te /
translated: First, if you say that

analyzed: de ltar gyur pa dang / de dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa yang 'dod pa nye bar len pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If that were so, then the appropriation of the desire realm would not be the appropriation of desire,

original: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yin par 'grub par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa rnams gal te rnam pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gi sgo nas de dag thams cad kyis bdag go zhes smras pas bdag tu smra ba yin gyi nya bar len pa gzhan
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yin par 'grub par 'gyur ro // 'on te gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa rnams gal te rnam pa gzhan 'ga' zhig gi sgo nas de dag thams cad kyis bdag go zhes smras pas bdag tu smra ba yin gyi nya bar len pa gzhan

original: ma yin no zhe na ni 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa yang rnam pa de lta bu nyid kyi sgo nas bdag tu smra ba yin pa thob par 'gyur ro //

translated: The same applies to the fetters of existence and the fetters of views as it does to the fetters of desire.

analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi srid pa ni kun 'byung ba yin /
translated: Monks, the existence of the childish, the ignorant, the ordinary person is a source of suffering,üîΩand it is a source of its disappearance.

original: nub pa yang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas srid pa la srid pa'i 'dun pa dang / srid pa'i dga' ba'i bar du 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nub pa yang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas srid pa la srid pa'i 'dun pa dang / srid pa'i dga' ba'i bar du 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, the desire for existence, up to and including the joy of existence, arises in them.

analyzed: srid pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i bar du 'di'i sems mthar thug par gnas te /

analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'o // lta ba'i sbyor ba yang dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skya bo rnams kyi lta ba ni kun 'byung ba yang yin / nub pa yang yin /
translated: This is called the fetter of existence.üîΩMonks, the views of the childish, the ignorant, the ordinary person are a source of suffering,üîΩand they are a source of its disappearance.

original: ro myang ba yang yin /
analyzed: ro myang ba yang yin /
translated: Monks, they experience the taste of views,üîΩand they are attached to views.

original: nyes dmigs kyang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas lta ba rnams la lta ba'i 'dun pa dang / lta ba'i dga' ba'i bar du 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas lta ba rnams la lta ba'i 'dun pa dang / lta ba'i dga' ba'i bar du 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and also the disadvantages, up to the thought of views and the delight in views arise.

original: lta ba'i lhag par zhen @179b pa'i bar du 'di sems mthar thug par gnas te /
analyzed: lta ba'i lhag par zhen @179b pa'i bar du 'di sems mthar thug par gnas te /
translated: up to the excessive attachment to views, the mind remains fixed on the extreme.

original: 'di ni lta ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba'i sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the application of views.

original: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the application of ignorance?

original: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi reg pa'i skye mched drug rnams kun 'byung ba yang yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi reg pa'i skye mched drug rnams kun 'byung ba yang yin /
translated: Monks, for the childish, the ignorant, the ordinary person, the arising of the six sense bases is suffering,üîΩand their cessation is peace.

original: nub pa yang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas reg pa'i skye mched drug mi shes pa ni ma rig pa phra rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: nub pa yang yin no zhes rgyas par byas nas reg pa'i skye mched drug mi shes pa ni ma rig pa phra rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni ma rig pa'i sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Not knowing the six sense bases, up to ignorance arises as latent tendencies. This is the application of ignorance.

original: 'dir yang ma rig pa nyid ma rig pa'i sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: mi 'dod pa byung ba rnams dang bral bar 'dod nas 'khor ba na phyis kyang sdug bsngal mang po med par bya'o zhes med par bya ba'i phyir rab tu 'byung ngo //

analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang bsam gtan dang rtog pa'i bye brag la brten nas rtag par lta ba'am /

analyzed: med par lta ba la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag par lta ba ni yod par lta ba la brten pa yin no //

analyzed: chad par lta ba ni med par lta ba la brten pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar na re zhig de dag ni lta ba nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these views are the appropriation of views.üîΩMorality and ascetic practices are also related to them.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyang de dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba de gnyis dang rjes su 'brel pa ni des bskyed pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //

original: de ltar na de dag ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa yin no //

original: gzhan lta bar gtogs pa de dag kyang lta ba gnyis la brten pa yin bar /
analyzed: gzhan lta bar gtogs pa de dag kyang lta ba gnyis la brten pa yin bar /

analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //

original: bdag tu smra ba yang yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba gnyis la brten ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba yang yod par lta ba dang / med par lta ba gnyis la brten ba yin te /

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na bdag yod pa dang med par yongs su rtog pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: yod par lta ba ni ma 'ongs pa na yang bdag yod par rtog par byed de //

original: med par lta ba ni med par ro //
analyzed: med par lta ba ni med par ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag tu lta ni lta ba nye bar len pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ni gnyis la brten pa yang yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag tu lta ni lta ba nye bar len pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ni gnyis la brten pa yang yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, the view of self is included in the appropriation of views, because it is based on the two.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad kyis de nye bar len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i @181a * //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa thams cad kyis de nye bar len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i @181a * //
translated: Because all outsiders appropriate it.

analyzed: phyir 'di las phyi rol pa de dag thams cad bdag tu smra ba nye bar len par mthun pa yin no // de bas na bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa spangs pa dang yongs su shes pa 'chad par mi byed de /
translated: All of these non-Buddhists are alike in that they advocate a self that appropriates.üîΩTherefore, the abandonment and thorough knowledge of the appropriation of the self that is advocated by the Buddha is not the same as that advocated by the non-Buddhists.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba can rnams ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa spangs par 'chad pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba can rnams ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa spangs par 'chad pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to explain the abandonment of the appropriation of the self that is advocated by the Buddha as the abandonment of the appropriation of the self that is advocated by the non-Buddhists.

original: gal te 'chad par byed na de'i phyir phyi rol pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'chad par byed na de'i phyir phyi rol pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to explain it in that way, then the Buddha would not be different from the non-Buddhists.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ngam zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ngam zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: This is why the Buddha said, ‚ÄúMonks, if a monk were to explain the abandonment of the appropriation of the self in the same way that the non-Buddhists do, he would not be a monk and he would not be a follower of the ≈õrama·πáa.‚Äù

original: sred pa ni gsum du bstan la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //

analyzed: nye bar len pa ni bzhi yin na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa rnams so //

analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rkyen gyis yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa gang zhig sred pa gang gi rkyen gyis yin zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de yang mthong ba'i chos kho na la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i srid pa gang yin pa de la brten nas de 'byung ba yin no //
