analyzed: rkyen nges pa yin na ni dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung pa'i chos yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams srid pa'i rkyen yin par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the condition were definite, it would not be established that wholesome minds and mental factors concomitant with right view are the condition of existence.

original: las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i mdo sde las /
analyzed: las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i mdo sde las /
translated: In the Great Division of Karma Sutra,

original: de dag srid pa'i rkyen nyid du gsungs pa de yang /
analyzed: de dag srid pa'i rkyen nyid du gsungs pa de yang /
translated: it is said that they are the condition of existence,

original: yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: but that would be completely rejected.

original: 'on te 'di 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe dge ba'i sems pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa srid pa yin par gyur na ni de lta na mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i
analyzed: 'on te 'di 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe dge ba'i sems pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa srid pa yin par gyur na ni de lta na mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i
translated: Or, if it is possible that at the time of death one possesses virtuous minds and concomitant states, then at that time nonvirtuous minds and mental factors do not exist.

original: chos rnams kyi rkyen gyis las de srid par gyur pa ma yin zhing rkyen nges pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rkyen gyis las de srid par gyur pa ma yin zhing rkyen nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, at the time of death, the condition of karma is definite because karma does not exist as a condition of existence.

original: nye bar len pa kho na srid pa'i rkyen yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa kho na srid pa'i rkyen yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang grub pa yin no //
translated: It is also established that appropriation alone is the condition of existence and not anything else.

original: las rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo sde chen po las gsungs pa de dag srid pa'i rkyen nyid yin par bstan pa yang spangs pa ma yin te /üîΩder ni de dag srid pa nyid yin par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: las rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo sde chen po las gsungs pa de dag srid pa'i rkyen nyid yin par bstan pa yang spangs pa ma yin te / der ni de dag srid pa nyid yin par gsungs kyi /
translated: It is not denied that the great sutra Differentiating the Classes of Karma states that appropriation is the condition of existence.

original: srid pa'i rkyen nyid du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen nyid du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is said there that appropriation is existence itself and not the condition of existence.

original: de lta na de yang sngon byas pa yod pa de'i rkyen yang 'di ste zhes byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na de yang sngon byas pa yod pa de'i rkyen yang 'di ste zhes byung ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would contradict the statement, ‚ÄúThat existence also exists due to previous karma, and its condition is this.‚Äù

original: sngon byas pa yod pa srid pa de'i rkyen nyid yin par gsungs pa yin gyi srid pa nyid du ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon byas pa yod pa srid pa de'i rkyen nyid yin par gsungs pa yin gyi srid pa nyid du ma yin no //
translated: It is said that the existence of previous karma is the condition of existence, but it is not said that existence itself is the condition of existence.

original: gshed ma pa dbugs zhes bya bas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang spang bar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gshed ma pa dbugs zhes bya bas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang spang bar byas pa yin te /
translated: The statement by the executioner Bhak·π£ita, ‚ÄúIf I were to kill someone, I would go to a miserable realm,‚Äù is also to be refuted.

original: gal te len pa kho na srid pa'i rkyen yin na zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te len pa kho na srid pa'i rkyen yin na zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: If appropriation alone were the condition of existence, this would be the case.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong zhes rgyas @188a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong zhes rgyas @188a * //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúA monk who obtains the fourth absorption,‚Äù and so on,

original: par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong 'ga' zhig bsam gtan dang po thob pa dang bdag gis thog ma'i 'bras bu 'thob po zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes zhes grag go //
analyzed: par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong 'ga' zhig bsam gtan dang po thob pa dang bdag gis thog ma'i 'bras bu 'thob po zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal skyes zhes grag go //
translated: means that it is well known that a monk who obtains the fourth absorption generates manifest pride in obtaining the first absorption, thinking, ‚ÄúI have obtained the first fruit.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du thob pa dang / 'bras bu bzhi pa dgra bcom pa thob bo snyam byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du thob pa dang / 'bras bu bzhi pa dgra bcom pa thob bo snyam byed do //
translated: In the same way, he obtains the four meditations and he thinks that he has obtained the fruit of arhatship.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong mngon pa'i nga rgyal can te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i dge slong mngon pa'i nga rgyal can te /
translated: The monk who has obtained the fourth meditation is full of pride.

original: 'chi kar skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ba dang / 'jig rten na rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du yod pa ma yin no zhes 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba skyes so //
analyzed: 'chi kar skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ba dang / 'jig rten na rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar du yod pa ma yin no zhes 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba skyes so //
translated: At the moment of death, he sees that he is going to be reborn in the realm of the second meditation. He then says: ‚ÄúThere are no noble persons in the world, no stream-enterers, etc., up to: no arhats.‚Äù He thus produces a false view that denies the noble persons.

original: de 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba de ni dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las srid pa nyid du byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba de ni dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i las srid pa nyid du byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This false view that denies the noble persons is the condition for the action that will produce his rebirth in hell.

original: 'di nyid kyi mdo sde'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi mdo sde'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: This is how we should understand the S≈´tra according to the MƒÅdhyamikas.

original: 'dis bsam gtan gyi sdom pa thob nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa las rnam par ldog pa'i rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas ngan song dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis bsam gtan gyi sdom pa thob nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa las rnam par ldog pa'i rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas ngan song dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Through this, one obtains the vows of meditative stabilization and the cause and condition of turning away from taking life and so on, one's body does not disintegrate and one is not born in the lower realms of hell.

original: 'on kyang 'di sngon mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags pa yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di sngon mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags pa yod de /
translated: However, one has previously engaged in and accumulated nonvirtuous karma.

original: de yang sngon byas pa yod pa de'i rkyen yang 'di lta ste 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thob pa log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /üîΩgal te len pa kho na rkyen yin te /üîΩrkyen nges pa yin na 'di yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang sngon byas pa yod pa de'i rkyen yang 'di lta ste 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thob pa log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig nas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin te / gal te len pa kho na rkyen yin te / rkyen nges pa yin na 'di yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the condition of that which was previously engaged in is as follows: at the time of death, through the cause and condition of the obtainment of nonvirtuous minds and mental factors concomitant with wrong view, one's body disintegrates and one is born in the lower realms of hell.üîΩIf the condition is ascertained as just the appropriator, then this is refuted.

original: gal te rkyen can nges pa yin na ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rkyen can nges pa yin na ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: If the possessor of the condition is ascertained, then existence is definitely the condition of the appropriator.

original: gzhan ma yin pas len pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu gzhan med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pas len pa'i rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu gzhan med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The karmic maturation result would not exist because it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro bar gyur pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro bar gyur pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The natural outflow result would not exist because it is the homogeneous cause and the all-pervading cause.

original: gtso bo'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdag po'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdag po'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The dominant result would not exist because it is the primary cause.üîΩBecause the primary condition is explained.

original: rkyen gtso bo 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba rkyen gtso bo'i dbang du byas te 'chad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlen pa ni srid pa'i rkyen gyi @188b gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gtso bo 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba rkyen gtso bo'i dbang du byas te 'chad pa'i phyir ro // len pa ni srid pa'i rkyen gyi @188b gtso bo yin te /
translated: The primary condition is explained in terms of the primary condition of grasping, which is existence.üîΩGrasping is the primary condition of existence because grasping of a certain level causes karma of that level to exist.

original: sa gang ba'i len pa yin pas ni sa de pa kho na'i las dag srid par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de yang sngar bstan zin te /
analyzed: sa gang ba'i len pa yin pas ni sa de pa kho na'i las dag srid par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de yang sngar bstan zin te /
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yod du zin kyang gang 'dun pa dang 'dod chags pa des 'phangs pa'i yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa med na der yang srid mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yod du zin kyang gang 'dun pa dang 'dod chags pa des 'phangs pa'i yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa med na der yang srid mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Even though formations exist due to the condition of ignorance, if the craving and attachment that impel rebirth do not exist, then rebirth will not be established there.

original: sa gang pa'i dge ba'i sems dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa gang ba'i dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni 'chi ba'i tshe /
analyzed: sa gang pa'i dge ba'i sems dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa gang ba'i dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba ni 'chi ba'i tshe /
translated: When a virtuous mind of a particular level is about to die,

original: dus tha ma'i tshe sa de pa'i las dag srid par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus tha ma'i tshe sa de pa'i las dag srid par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: at the time of death, virtuous minds and mental factors of that level do not generate karma that projects rebirth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i kun du 'byung yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las dag srid par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bdag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i kun du 'byung yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las dag srid par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: When one who is free from attachment to the desire realm dies, a virtuous mind and mental factors active in the desire realm arise at the time of death, but they do not generate karma active in the desire realm.

original: 'o na dge ba'i sems kyi las gang dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge ba'i sems kyi las sngon byas pa bag chags kyi gnas skabs pa dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe srid par gyur pa yin pa ni ji ltar sngar smras pa yin no //üîΩde dag ji ltar nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de'i sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags mngon du 'byung ba'i dngos po ni
analyzed: 'o na dge ba'i sems kyi las gang dag ces rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge ba'i sems kyi las sngon byas pa bag chags kyi gnas skabs pa dag 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe srid par gyur pa yin pa ni ji ltar sngar smras pa yin no // de dag ji ltar nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de'i sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags mngon du 'byung ba'i dngos po ni
translated: The actions of a virtuous mind that were previously performed and are in the state of latent impressions become existence at the time of death, as was previously explained.üîΩHow are they existence due to the condition of grasping?

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, there is no entity that is the manifestation of aspiration and attachment that is incompatible with the occurrence of virtuous minds and mental factors.üîΩIf at that time consciousness...

original: gal te de'i tshe rnam par shes pa la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'chi ba'i dus de'i tshe dge ba'i sems kyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la len pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe rnam par shes pa la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'chi ba'i dus de'i tshe dge ba'i sems kyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la len pa med par gyur na /
translated: If at the time of death the consciousness of a virtuous mind and the consciousness of the storehouse of all seeds are not grasped,

original: de'i las dag srid pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i las dag srid pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: those actions will not become existence.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la len pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the arhat, because there is no appropriation in the foundation consciousness.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa la len pa med par yang bag chags kyi gnas skabs dag srid pa yin par gyur na ni srid par gyur pa de ni las kyi bag chags kyi nang du gtogs pa yang srid kyi sa bon du gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa la len pa med par yang bag chags kyi gnas skabs dag srid pa yin par gyur na ni srid par gyur pa de ni las kyi bag chags kyi nang du gtogs pa yang srid kyi sa bon du gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the state of the latent impressions were possible without appropriation of consciousness, then that possibility would be included in the latent impressions of karma, but it would not be a seed.

original: de lta yin na dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs lnga ni len pa dang bcas pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mdo 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs lnga ni len pa dang bcas pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes 'byung ba'i mdo 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would contradict this sutra: ‚ÄúMonks, the five types of seeds are called with appropriation.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na dge ba'i rnam par shes pa len pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge ba ni 'dun @189a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na dge ba'i rnam par shes pa len pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge ba ni 'dun @189a * //
translated: How can consciousness be virtuous and have appropriation?

original: pa dang 'dod chags dang rab tu sbyor ba ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dang 'dod chags dang rab tu sbyor ba ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Since virtue is not intention, craving, or application, he asks this question.

original: len pas grogs byas te 'bras bu sbyin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: len pas grogs byas te 'bras bu sbyin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni skyed pa yin te /
translated: Because it assists the appropriating consciousness and causes it to give forth its result.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba de ni len pas bstangs te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba de ni len pas bstangs te /
translated: That virtuous actual consciousness is assisted by the appropriating consciousness.

original: 'bras bu sbyin par byed kyi 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu sbyin par byed kyi 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It causes the result to be given forth, but not by itself alone.

original: de bas na de len pa dang bcas pa yin gyi zhes bya ste /üîΩlen pa la ltos nas des 'bras bu mngon du sbyin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de len pa dang bcas pa yin gyi zhes bya ste / len pa la ltos nas des 'bras bu mngon du sbyin par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be associated with the appropriating consciousness.üîΩIn dependence on the appropriating consciousness, it causes the result to be given forth.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'bras bu'i rgyu bag chags rgyu yod pas 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'bras bu'i rgyu bag chags rgyu yod pas 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The result is given forth because the cause, the latent seeds, exist in the storehouse consciousness.üîΩIt is not the intention that that is the seed.

original: de sa bon yin par dgongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de'o //
analyzed: de sa bon yin par dgongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa de'o //
translated: That virtuous actual consciousness is the actual consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sa bon yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sa bon yin te /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is the seed.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag sa bon zhes bya ba ni len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag sa bon zhes bya ba ni len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this regard, the Lord has said, ‚ÄúMonks, seed is a term for consciousness that appropriates.‚Äù

original: de la len pa gang yin pa'i bag chags zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la len pa gang yin pa'i bag chags zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Here, the latent impressions of appropriation are fully developed.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: Here means in the store consciousness.

original: len pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dod pa nye bar len pa nas bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i bar gyi bag chags yongs su shin du brtas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni de kun du 'byung ba na 'jug pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: len pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba 'dod pa nye bar len pa nas bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i bar gyi bag chags yongs su shin du brtas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni de kun du 'byung ba na 'jug pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: The latent impressions of appropriation are fully developed means that when the appropriation of desire, etc., up to the appropriation of the doctrine of self is fully developed, it occurs.

original: des ni de len pa dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni len pa des bag chags yongs su brtas pa ma yin na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de len pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni de len pa dang bcas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni len pa des bag chags yongs su brtas pa ma yin na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de len pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: That consciousness is said to be with appropriation means that if that appropriation is not fully developed, the store consciousness is not with appropriation.

original: sa gang pa'i len pa de yongs su shin tu brtas par gyur na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i bar gyi'o //
analyzed: sa gang pa'i len pa de yongs su shin tu brtas par gyur na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa'i bar gyi'o //
translated: it is the appropriator of the level of the desire realm, the level of the first absorption, up to the level of the peak of existence.üîΩThrough that, the latent tendencies of karma of that very level are accumulated,

original: de'i sgo nas sa de pa nyid kyi las kyi bag chags bsags pa'i zhes bya ba ni len pa'i sgo nas bsags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas sa de pa nyid kyi las kyi bag chags bsags pa'i zhes bya ba ni len pa'i sgo nas bsags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that they are accumulated through the appropriator.üîΩImmediately after that, it is existence because it obtains the entry to actualize another life.

original: de ma thag tu tshe gzhan mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa rnyed pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag gi gnas skabs rnyed pa'i las de ni srid pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ma thag tu tshe gzhan mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa rnyed pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag gi gnas skabs rnyed pa'i las de ni srid pa yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that existence is the karma that obtains the state of the specific transformation.

original: rnam pa 'dis ni dge ba'i sems kyi yang 'chi kar len pa'i rkyen nyid kyis srid pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis ni dge ba'i sems kyi yang 'chi kar len pa'i rkyen nyid kyis srid pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: By this aspect, it is said that even in a virtuous mind, it is existence through the condition of appropriating at the time of death.

original: de ma thag tu skye ba mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa rnyed pa zhes gang smras pa'i /
analyzed: de ma thag tu skye ba mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa rnyed pa zhes gang smras pa'i /
translated: Immediately after that, in order to establish the arising of the effect, the state of the latent karmic imprint is said to be ‚Äúobtained.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is this state called ‚Äúobtained‚Äù?üîΩTherefore, it is said in detail:

original: de'i phyir / @189b gang la las kyi bag chags yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag yod pa zhes rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / @189b gang la las kyi bag chags yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag yod pa zhes rgyas par smras te /
translated: The state of the latent karmic imprint that has the specific transformation of the latent karmic imprint.

original: 'du byed skad cig ma rnams ni skad cig re re la yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag yod pa yin no //üîΩde bas na yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag 'ga' zhig ston par byed pa ni gang la las kyi bag chags kyi gnas skabs yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag yod pa rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa de ni 'di'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'du byed skad cig ma rnams ni skad cig re re la yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag yod pa yin no // de bas na yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag 'ga' zhig ston par byed pa ni gang la las kyi bag chags kyi gnas skabs yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag yod pa rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa de ni 'di'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba
translated: Momentary formations have a specific transformation in each moment.üîΩTherefore, the state of the latent karmic imprint that has a specific transformation is the state that produces its own effect. That is called ‚Äúobtained.‚Äù

original: yin te yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag de ni bag chags 'di'i 'jug pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: yin te yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag de ni bag chags 'di'i 'jug pa yin par bstan te /
translated: That specific transformation is taught to be the ‚Äúobtainment‚Äù of the latent karmic imprint.

original: dper na ma du lung ga'i me tog la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bsgos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ma du lung ga'i me tog la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bsgos pa ci zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the following: What is the difference between a maddula flower and a maddula flower that is dyed with lac?

original: yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag gis ge sar dmar por mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag gis ge sar dmar por mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: The maddula flower is the basis, and the maddula flower that is dyed with lac is the transformation.

original: gang gi phyir srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa yin par rtog par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa yin par rtog par byed ce na /
translated: Why is it that the condition of existence is considered to be grasping?

original: de'i phyir / tshor ba la sred pa ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / tshor ba la sred pa ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, craving for feeling is definitely, etc.

original: de dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to possess it and be separated from it means in order to possess and be separated from feeling.

original: de bas na bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa len par byed la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang /
analyzed: de bas na bde ba'i tshor ba dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa len par byed la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang /
translated: Therefore, in order to possess pleasant feeling and be separated from painful feeling, one grasps desire, etc.

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means ‚Äúthose who speak of a self.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúinextricably bound‚Äù is shown by the statement:

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin par ston pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis kyi tshor ba la ldan pa dang bral bar sred pa ni gdon mi za bar 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags par byed do zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin par ston pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis kyi tshor ba la ldan pa dang bral bar sred pa ni gdon mi za bar 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags par byed do zhes bya ba 'di
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is pleasure and pain, craving for contact and separation arises, and this in turn produces desire and attachment for sense objects, etc.‚Äù

original: ni bsdus pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: ni bsdus pa'i don yin te /
translated: This is the condensed meaning.

original: de ltar na len pa med par yang las rnams srid par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na len pa med par yang las rnams srid par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, karma is not possible without appropriation.

original: de bas na srid pa'i rkyen kho nas srid pa yin par 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na srid pa'i rkyen kho nas srid pa yin par 'dod pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that existence is not asserted to be conditioned by existence alone.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa len pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa len pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the appropriation of sense objects, etc.‚Äù refers to the appropriation of sense objects, views, morality and spiritual disciplines, and the assertion of a self.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: tshor ba tsam la sred pas ni las sna tshogs kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams ldan pa dang bral ba la sogs par sred pa sna tshogs ma yin pa lus dang longs spyod @190a * //üîΩsgrub par byed pa can gyis ni /
analyzed: tshor ba tsam la sred pas ni las sna tshogs kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams ldan pa dang bral ba la sogs par sred pa sna tshogs ma yin pa lus dang longs spyod @190a * // sgrub par byed pa can gyis ni /
translated: Craving for mere feeling does not motivate the various karmas.üîΩCraving for various feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain, such as being united with what is attractive, being separated from what is repulsive, and so on, does not motivate the various karmas.

original: las sna tshogs kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: las sna tshogs kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Craving for the body and resources that are established by the various karmas does not motivate the various karmas.

original: len pas yin te /
analyzed: len pas yin te /
translated: But appropriation does.

original: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba sna tshogs las byung pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba sna tshogs las byung pa'i 'dod chags rnam pa sna tshogs 'grub pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it establishes the various types of attachment that arise from the various views of desire, view, discipline and ritual, and self.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas kun nas bslang ba'i las sna tshogs ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba sna tshogs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas kun nas bslang ba'i las sna tshogs ni 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba sna tshogs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas te /
translated: The various actions motivated by desire and attachment for sense objects, etc.üîΩare the desire realm. The various actions motivated by desire and attachment for views, morality and vows, and self-theories are the form realm.üîΩThe various actions motivated by desire and attachment for meditative concentration are the formless realm.üîΩThe various actions motivated by desire and attachment for the desire realm, etc.

original: sgo de kho na nas phyis srid pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo kho na nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgo de kho na nas phyis srid pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo kho na nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: are the desire realm, etc.

original: de ltar na yang sred pa'i rkyen kho nas srid pa yin par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang sred pa'i rkyen kho nas srid pa yin par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, existence is only motivated by craving.

original: ngan song du 'gro bas skrag pa dang bde 'gro 'dod pa rnams kyi 'gro ba de dang mi mthun pa'i sred pa ngan song du 'gro ba dang mi mthun zhing de dang mi 'phrod pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro bas skrag pa dang bde 'gro 'dod pa rnams kyi 'gro ba de dang mi mthun pa'i sred pa ngan song du 'gro ba dang mi mthun zhing de dang mi 'phrod pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i
translated: The meaning of the statement that craving for a realm is incompatible with going to that realm is that craving for a realm is incompatible with going to a realm that is not that realm.

original: las rnams srid par byed pa'i rkyen du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: las rnams srid par byed pa'i rkyen du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that karma is a condition for existence,

original: ngan song las phyir phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song las phyir phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is turned away from the miserable realms.

original: bde 'gro'i tshor ba la sred pa sngon du song ba'i 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i 'gro ba la skrag pa dang / bde 'gro 'dod pa de dag rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i tshor ba la sred pa sngon du song ba'i 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni 'thad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i 'gro ba la skrag pa dang / bde 'gro 'dod pa de dag rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is tenable that craving for the feelings of the happy realms, preceded by craving, is the desire and attachment for sense objects, etc.

original: de ltar na srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa nyid yin pa ni thams cad du 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa nyid yin pa ni thams cad du 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory that grasping exists due to the condition of craving in all cases.

original: gang dag gi sred pa srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang / yang srid dang mi mthun par byed pa dag gi ni de'i rkyen gyis srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sred pa'i rkyen gyis /
analyzed: gang dag gi sred pa srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang / yang srid dang mi mthun par byed pa dag gi ni de'i rkyen gyis srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sred pa'i rkyen gyis /
translated: For those whose craving turns away from existence and acts contrary to existence, due to the condition of craving, existence turns away from them.

original: ji ltar las dag srid par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sred pa yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral bar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar las dag srid par 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sred pa yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral bar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The craving that turns away from existence is not in accord with existence, since it is the desire to be free from the feeling of suffering.

original: srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i srid pa'i rkyen gyis lta ba la sogs pa'i len pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i srid pa'i rkyen gyis lta ba la sogs pa'i len pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The appropriation of views, etc. is established through the condition of existence for one who turns away from existence.

original: de'i phyir yang srid pa'i rkyen kho nas srid pa yin par bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang srid pa'i rkyen kho nas srid pa yin par bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, existence is not taught to be the condition of existence alone.

original: 'o na gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan nas dga' ba nyid len pa yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: 'o na gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan nas dga' ba nyid len pa yin par gsungs la /
translated: Well then, how is it that the Lord has said elsewhere that craving is appropriation?üîΩAnd that it is the condition of existence is stated in the s≈´tra on feeling.

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang srid pa @190b yin par tshor ba'i mdo sde las gsungs par rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gis ni sred pa'i rkyen kho nas srid par 'gyur ba yin par ston par byed pa ni dga' ba de ni sred pa yin par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang srid pa @190b yin par tshor ba'i mdo sde las gsungs par rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gis ni sred pa'i rkyen kho nas srid par 'gyur ba yin par ston par byed pa ni dga' ba de ni sred pa yin par bsams pa'o //
translated: The point of these passages is to show that existence comes about through the condition of craving alone. The craving that is mentioned is craving that is in accord with existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa dga' ba 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes 'byung bas mdo sde'i tshig 'di dag sred pa yin par rung la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa dga' ba 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes 'byung bas mdo sde'i tshig 'di dag sred pa yin par rung la /
translated: Therefore, since it is said that craving is associated with delight and attachment, these words of the sutra are suitable as craving.

original: der yang lha rnams mgu ba ni dga' ba la brten pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs so zhe na zhes smras so //
analyzed: der yang lha rnams mgu ba ni dga' ba la brten pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs so zhe na zhes smras so //
translated: And there it is said that delighting in the gods is based on delight.üîΩIt is not suitable to say that craving is existence and attachment.

original: srid pa dang 'dod chags mtshungs par ldan pa sred pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan 'dres pa la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod chags mtshungs par ldan pa sred pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan 'dres pa la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is mixed with something else is said to be associated with it.

original: dper na byams pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom mo zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byams pa dang ldan pa'i dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom mo zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúOne cultivates the mindfulness factor of perfect enlightenment that is associated with love.‚Äù

original: dga' ba yang dga' bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba yang dga' bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Delight is that which delights.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: The afflicted mind is called delight and it is associated with attachment.

original: len pa ni tshor ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa nye bar len pa yin par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len pa ni tshor ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa nye bar len pa yin par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical to say that appropriation is only feeling, because it is the intrinsic identity of a thing, and because it is said that craving and desire are appropriation here.

original: tshor ba la dga' ba ni srid pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa dang bral ba sred pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la dga' ba ni srid pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa dang bral ba sred pa yin te /
translated: Delight in feeling is the cause of existence, because craving is the separation and possession of that.

original: dga' ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Delight is a specific instance of the feeling of pleasure.

original: de yang len pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sred pa de yang rgyu yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang len pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sred pa de yang rgyu yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: And that is also appropriation, because that craving is also a cause.

original: rgyu'i rgyu la de'i len pa yin no zhes bya ba ni len pa'i rgyu ni sred pa yin /
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyu la de'i len pa yin no zhes bya ba ni len pa'i rgyu ni sred pa yin /
translated: The cause of the cause is its appropriation. The cause of appropriation is craving.

original: sred pa'i rgyu ni dga' ba yin pas rgyu'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu ni dga' ba yin pas rgyu'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of craving is delight. Therefore, it is the cause of the cause.

original: de'i zhes gang smras pa ni de'i zhes bya ba gang zag dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i zhes gang smras pa ni de'i zhes bya ba gang zag dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúits appropriation‚Äù refers to the person.

original: gang zag de'i len pa'i rgyu la len pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag de'i len pa'i rgyu la len pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The cause of appropriation is taught to be appropriation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshor ba la dga' ba mang ba rnams yid 'byung ba skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor ba la dga' ba mang ba rnams yid 'byung ba skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to generate disgust in those who delight in feeling.

original: dga' ba nyid len pa yin no zhes byas na de dag tshor ba la yid 'byung ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' ba nyid len pa yin no zhes byas na de dag tshor ba la yid 'byung ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If appropriation were delight, they would generate disgust for feeling,

original: dga' ba'i nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would see the faults of delight.

original: des de la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags des tshangs par spyod pa de la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des de la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags des tshangs par spyod pa de la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it obstructs that, i.e., because that attachment obstructs pure conduct.

original: dri ma brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pas bud med la dri ma'o zhes nye bar gdags te zhes bya ba ni bud med mthong na zhes rgyas par ji skad du smras pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: dri ma brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pas bud med la dri ma'o zhes nye bar gdags te zhes bya ba ni bud med mthong na zhes rgyas par ji skad du smras pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The term ‚Äústain‚Äù is figuratively designated to women because they are the cause of the transmission of stains.

original: dper na / sangs @191a * //
analyzed: dper na / sangs @191a * //
translated: For example, it is said:

original: rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of the Buddhas is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba sangs rgyas 'byung ba kho na bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sangs rgyas 'byung ba kho na bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not only the appearance of the Buddha that is happiness.

original: zhal mthong na dang ba skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhal mthong na dang ba skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: When one sees his face, faith arises.

original: dang ba las bde bar 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩchos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba las bde bar 'gyur ba yin no // chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //
translated: And from faith, happiness arises.

original: zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is also happiness.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rgyu'i rgyu gzhan la yang de bzhin du nye bar gdags pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rgyu'i rgyu gzhan la yang de bzhin du nye bar gdags pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The same is to be applied to the other causes of the cause.

original: smras pa / gal te srid pa'i brgyud pa'i rgyu sred pa yin na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te srid pa'i brgyud pa'i rgyu sred pa yin na /
translated: Objection: If craving is the cause of the continuum of existence,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las srid pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden par gsungs /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las srid pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden par gsungs /
translated: why is existence declared to be the truth of origin in another s≈´tra?

original: srid pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden par brjod par bya dgos so zhes bsams pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bden par brjod par bya dgos so zhes bsams pa ste /
translated: It should be said that existence itself is the truth of origin.
